SourceText: Sorry to hear that things are difficult between you and your children @fields.user_name. Sometimes it’s easy, sometimes it’s not. Let go of the mistakes and celebrate the wins, however small! Remember you can always get extra support by typing "Help".

SourceText: Be gentle with yourself @fields.user_name. Just because something didn’t go well today, or you lost your temper, this doesn’t define who you are as a parent. Remind yourself of the things you did well today, even if they may seem small.
text: Inahanele @fields.user_name. Hore feela ntho e itseng ha e a tsamaya hantle kajeno, kapa o ile wa tlakoloha ke bohale, seo hase hlalose hore na o motswadi ya jwang. Ikgopotse dintho tse tsamaileng hantle kajeno, le haeba di bonahala eka di nyane.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that things are difficult @fields.user_name. Whatever you feel you did ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It’s ok!

SourceText: You don’t have to do this alone! Please feel free to share your ParentText journey with other adults in your household and elsewhere. They might want to sign up to receive the messages too!
text: O se ke wa ba podumo ya moema notshi! Ke kopa o lokolohile ho nka leeto la hao la ParentText le batho ba bang ba baholo lapeng le kae kapa kae. Mohlomong le bona ba ka thabela ho saena hore ba amohele melaetsa!

SourceText: Would you like to receive a link to this programme, so you can share it with adults in your household?
text: Na o ka thabela ho amohela linki ya lenaneo lee, e le hore o ka le abela batho ba baholo bao o dulang le bona lapeng?

SourceText: It can be much more fun doing something with another person than doing it by yourself.
text: Ekaba ntho e monate haholo ha o etsa ntho e itseng le motho e mong ho feta ha o e etsa o le mong.

SourceText: Would you like to receive a link to this programme that you can share with a friend?
text: Na o ka thabela ho amohela linki ya lenaneo lee eo o ka e fetisetsang ho motswalle wa hao?

SourceText: It looks like you are busy right now. Please type “GoBack” to receive the most recent messages again.
text: Ekare o phathahane hona jwale. Ka kopo thaepa “GoBack” hore o amohele melaetsa ya moraorao hape.

SourceText: That is great!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate!

SourceText: That is okay! If would like to access the link at a later time, please type "Help".
text: Ho lokile! Haeba o ka rata ho fihlella linki ena hamorao, ka kopo thaepa “Thuso”.

SourceText: If you have already noticed some changes in your life or relationship with your children, that's great!
text: Haeba o se o bone diphetoho tse itseng bophelong ba hao kapa kamanong le bana ba hao, tseo ke ditaba tse monate!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. We know you can do it!
text: Haeba ho hang ha o eso bone diphetoho, hle o se ke wa tela. Ka dinako tse ding dintho di fetoha kamora nako. Rea tseba hore o ka atleha!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. I know you can do it!
text: Haeba ho hang ha o eso bone diphetoho, hle o se ke wa tela. Ka dinako tse ding dintho di fetoha kamora nako. Kea tseba hore o ka atleha!

SourceText: It can be exhausting when your children have too much energy or can't focus on one thing. Sometimes, your children need opportunities to be very active and run around to help them be calm afterwards.
text: O ka ikutlwa o kgathetse ha bana ba hao ba le matjato haholo kapa ba sa kgone ho tsepamisa mohopolo nthong e le nngwe Ka dinako tse ding bana ba hao ba hloka menyetla ya ho ba mahlahahlaha le ho mathaka hohle mona ho ba thusa hore ba theole moya kamora moo.

SourceText: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with your child?
text: Na o ka thabela ditshisinyo tsa dintho tseo o ka di etsang le ngwana wa hao tse hlokang ho ba mahlahahlaha le ho kgutsa?

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night). It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Hopola hore o ikarabella ka seo a se jang, eseng hore na o ja hakae. Masea a qetang ho hlaha a na le mala a lekanang le morara! A tlameha ho ja kgafetsa (ka dinako tse ding hara mpa ya bosiu). Ho bohlokwa ho etsa hore le tshepane tabeng ya dijo, haholoholo ha lesea la hao le qala ho ja dijo tse tiileng. Mo tsebise hore o mametse ha a bua ka seo a lakatsang ho se ja. Haufinyane o tla boela a ja sampana-phatloha!

SourceText: Your baby will cry as soon as a caregiver’s attention is diverted and are cranky as well as clingy. Prioritise being there for them and give them physical contact when needed.
text: Ngwana wa hao o tla lla hang ha mohlokomedi a mo hlokomoloha mme e be sefelapelwana ebile o tla mo mamarela. Ntho ya pele ke ho mo hlokomela le ho mo tshwara ka tsela eo a hlokang ka yona.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more?
text: Na o ka thabela ho ithuta ho iketsehileng?

SourceText: Your baby or toddler may sometimes want something that they cannot have. If they start whining, first check to see if there is something wrong (are they actually hungry or tired)? If they continue, try to redirect their attention to something else. You should also try to ignore their behaviour while attending to them for comfort and support
text: Ka dinako tse ding lesea la hao le batla dintho tseo le ke keng la ba le tsona. Ha a llela hodimo, qala ka ho sheba hore na ho na le ntho e sa tsamayeng hantle (na ehlile le lapile kapa le kgathetse)? Ha le ntse le tswela pele, leka ho le bontsha ntho e nngwe. Hape o lokela ho leka ho iphapanyetsa boitshwaro ba lona ha o ntse o le thusa hore le thole le ho le tshehetsa

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
text: Ha ke tsebe hore na o bua kang.

SourceText: Check to see why @fields.child_nickname is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for @fields.child_nickname when they are having a difficult day.
text: Sheba hore na ke hobaneng ha @fields.child_nickname a halefile. Na o kgathetse kapa o lapile? Kapa na mohlomong ha a phela hantle? Kapa mohlomong o hloka tlhokomelo e itseng e lerato le ho feta. Ka boteng ba hao mo thoobe maikutlo @fields.child_nickname ha letsatsi le sa mo tsamaele hamonate.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Check to see why your baby is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for your baby when they are having a difficult day.
text: Sheba hore na ke hobaneng ha lesea la hao le halefile. Na o kgathetse kapa o lapile? Kapa na mohlomong ha a phela hantle? Kapa mohlomong o hloka tlhokomelo e itseng e lerato le ho feta. Ka boteng ba hao thoba lesea la hao maikutlo ha letsatsi le sa mo tsamaele hamonate.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing @fields.child_nickname close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and @fields.child_nickname will get through it together!
text: Ka maswabi lesea la hao le tla feta mekgahlelong ya ho se robale hantle ka dilemo tse tlang tse pedi. Leka ho le @fields.child_nickname atametsa haufi le wena ha o le apesa, o le jesa le ha o le pepile ka thari. Mme re sa le moo, hopola hore ke mokgahlelo wa kgolo. Wena le @fields.child_nickname le tla feta boemong bona hammoho!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing your baby close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and your baby will get through it together!
text: Ka maswabi lesea la hao le tla feta mekgahlelong ya ho se robale hantle ka dilemo tse tlang tse pedi. Leka ho atametsa lesea la hao haufi le wena ha o le apesa, o le jesa le ha o le pepile ka thari. Mme re sa le moo, hopola hore ke mokgahlelo wa kgolo. Wena le lesea la hao le tla feta boemong bona hammoho!

SourceText: Pay close attention to @fields.child_nickname in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
text: Hlokomela @fields.child_nickname ka ho kgetheha maemong ao le ka lekang ntho e itseng e kotsi! Hore ebe le se le kgona ho bapala le le leng, se hase bolelele hore o ka sheba kwana ka nako e telele. Mo kgutlise ha a seba ka ho tlwaela ho mo hwehla ka letsoho, dipapadi tsa ho etsisa, ho bina le dipapadi tsa ho tsamaya le ho etsa eka o bua ka founo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Pay close attention to your baby in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
text: Hlokomela lesea la hao ka ho kgetheha maemong ao le ka lekang ntho e itseng e kotsi! Hore ebe le se le kgona ho bapala le le leng, se hase bolelele hore o ka sheba kwana ka nako e telele. SourceText: Try to stay calm and support @fields.child_nickname as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to @fields.child_nickname’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.
text: Leka ho dula o kgobile matshwafo le ho tshehetsa @fields.child_nickname ha a feta mokgahlelong wa ho ithabukanya. Ntho e ka sehloohong eo o lokelang ho ameha ka yona ke hore ha a itematse. O se ke wa halefisa @fields.child_nickname le ho feta ka ho mo omanya le ho bontsha maikutlo a ho halefa. Seo se ke ke sa o tswela molemo.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to stay calm and support your toddler as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to your child’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.
text: Leka ho dula o kgobile matshwafo le ho tshehetsa ngwana wa hao ha a feta mokgahlelong wa ho ithabukanya. Ntho e ka sehloohong eo o lokelang ho ameha ka yona ke hore ha a itematse. O se ke wa halefisa ngwana wa hao le ho feta ka ho mo omanya le ho bontsha maikutlo a ho halefa. Seo se ke ke sa o tswela molemo.

SourceText: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by @fields.child_nickname.
text: Bana ba tla ba le tjantjello e ngata ya ho etsa dintho haeba o etsa hore ketso ebe e thabisang le e nang le papadi. Hape mamello e tswala katleho. Phefumulohela hodimo ha o lemoha hore o qala ho tenwa ke @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by your baby.

SourceText: All children behave badly sometimes. Here are a list of typical behaviours that can be challenging for parents:
text: Bana bohle ba itshwara hampe ka dinako tse ding. Bona lethathamo la boitshwaro bo tlwaelehileng bo ka thatafalletsang batswadi:

SourceText: 1. Refuse to obey instructions
text: 1. Ho hana ho mamela ditaelo

SourceText: 2. Gets angry a lot
text: 2. Ho halefa haholo

SourceText: 3. Rudeness, disrespectful behaviour
text: 3. Ho tella, boitshwaro bo bontshang ho se hlomphe

SourceText: 4. Irritable, frequent mood changes

SourceText: 5. Does not follow rules
text: 5. Ho se latele melao

SourceText: 6. Stubbornness
text: 6. Manganga

SourceText: 7. Breaking things
text: 7. Ho roba dintho

SourceText: 8. Getting into fights
text: 8. Ho dulela ho lwana

SourceText: 9. Teasing or bothering others
text: 9. Ho soma kapa ho tshwenya ba bang

SourceText: It is hard to find time to have fun with your children. How many days in the past week did you do something fun together? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ho thata ho fumana nako ya ho ba le bana ba hao. Bekeng e fetileng le qetile matsatsi a makae le etsa ntho eo le e thabelang mmoho? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: If you don't want to answer, please type 99.

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with a number between 0 and 7.
text: Ha ke tsebe hore na o bua kang. Ka kopo karabong ya hao e be palo e pakeng tsa 0 le 7.

SourceText: Amazing that you keep doing fun things with your child. You are the best parent they could wish for!
text: Ke ntho e tsotehang hore ebe o etsa dintho tseo o di thabelang le ngwana wa hao. O motswadi wa sebele eo ngwana a ka lakatsang ho ba le yena!

SourceText: Great that you are setting aside time with your child – it is THE foundation for a happy home!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate hore ebe o ipha nako ya ngwana wa hao – ke WONA motheo wa malapa a thabileng!

SourceText: Finding time to do something fun with your child can be hard, I understand! The great thing is that spending time together will make other things go easier – you will see!
text: Kea utlwisisa hore ho ka ba thata ho fumana ntho eo o thabelang ho e etsa le ngwana wa hao! Ntho e ntle ke hore ho qeta nako mmoho ho etsa hore dintho tse ding di be bonolo haholo – o tla bona!

SourceText: Give yourself credit for trying. A 5 minutes of fun activity with your child a day can make a BIG difference.
text: Ikopele mahofi hobane o itekile. Ho qeta metsotso e 5 ka letsatsi le etsa ntho e monate ho ka tlisang phapang e KGOLO.

SourceText: Life can get so busy sometimes, I know! If you start spending time together doing one small activity, it will get easier over time!
text: Kea tseba hore bophelo bo maphathaphathe! Haeba leka qala ho qeta nako mmoho le etsa ntho e nyane, ho tla ba bonolo ha nako e ntse e feta!

SourceText: In our busy lives, it's hard to focus on the positive. How many days in the past week have you praised your child? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Bophelong ba rona bo maphathaphathe, ho thata ho tsepamisa mohopolo dinthong tse molemo. O ile wa babatsa ngwana wa hao ka matsatsi a makae bekeng e fetileng? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all sometimes feel like our children are causing more negativity than positivity. Try to see through negative attitudes and praise any positive behaviour you notice. With time, you will see the change!
text: Ka dinako tse ding kaofela ha rona re utlwa eka bana ba rona ba re bakela mathata ho feta manolo. Leka ho hlokomoloha mekgwa e mebe mme o babatse boitshwaro bofe kapa bofe bo botle boo o bo bonang. Na nako e ntse e feta, o tla bona phetoho!

SourceText: This is a very stressful time for families. How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ena ke nako e boima haholo ho malapa. O qetile matsatsi a makae bekeng e fetileng o ikutlwa o imetswe haholo maikutlong jwaloka motswadi/kapa mohlokomedi? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: Would you like a brief activity to help you with stress?
text: Na o ka thabela mosebetsi o mokgutshwanyane ho o thusa ha o imetswe maikutlong?

SourceText: Would like a brief relaxing activity now?
text: Na o ka thabela ho etsa ntho e o kgathollang hanyane hona jwale?

SourceText: Sometimes our children make us really upset. How many days in the past week did you shout, scream, or yell at your children? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ka dinako tse ding bana ba ka o halefisa kannete. O ile wa kgaruma, wa omanya kapa wa tjwedietsa bana ba hao ka matsatsi a makae bekeng e fetileng? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: It can be difficult to control our anger, especially when they make us really angry. Take a deep breath, and be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Ho ka ba thata ho laola kgalefo ya hao, haholoholo ha ba o halefisitse e le kannete. Phefumulohela hodimo, mme o be motlotlo ka wena ha o kgonne ho laola bohale ba hao!

SourceText: Sorry that you are having a difficult time with your child. It happens to all of us. Remember, we can choose to behave differently next time.
text: Ke maswabi hore dintho ha di tsamaye hantle pakeng tsa hao le ngwana wa hao. Sena sea re etsahalla kaofela. Hopola hore re ka kgetha ho itshwara ka tsela e fepaneng nakong e tlang.

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!
text: Ha ho bonolo ho ba motswadi. Leka ho imamella le ho mamella ba lelapa la hao, mme o ke o nke nako o le mong haeba ho hlokeha. Haeba re tobana le diphephetso re kgobile matshwafo, re ka di rarolla mmoho!

SourceText: Great work! When we respond calmly, our teens are more likely to do the same.
text: Mosebetsi o tswileng matsoho! Ha re arabela re kgobile matshwafo, batjha ba rona le bona ba tla etsa se tshwanang.

SourceText: Our children can really drive us crazy sometimes. By responding calmly, they will learn to do the same when something upsets them at home or outside. Your patience will pay off, you will see!
text: Ka dinako tse ding bana ba rona ba ka re fetola mahlanya. Ha re arabela re kgobile matshwafo, ba tla ithuta ho etsa se tshwanang haeba ho na le ntho e ba kgopisang lapeng kapa kantle. Mamello e tswala katleho, o tla bona!

SourceText: It is so stressful when children misbehave. How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ekaba ntho e imelang maikutlong haholo ha bana ba sa itshware hantle. Ke ka matsatsi a makae bekeng e fetileng o ileng wa kgalemela bana ba hao ka hore o ba ba otle, o ba shape kapa o ba jabele ka mpama kapa ka ntho e kang thupa kapa lebanta? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all struggle to stay calm sometimes. Take a deep breath and remember that mistakes are human. Talking to your child will help more in the end – you are an awesome parent!
text: Ka dinako tse ding kaofela re thatafallwa ho dula re kgobile matshwafo. Phefumulohela hodimo mme o hopole hore ha ho tjaka-tlhoka-kodi etswe diphoso di tsamaya le mohatisi. Qetellong ho molemo ho buisana le ngwana haholo – o motswadi wa mmakgonthe!

SourceText: It can be so difficult to keep calm when things get out of hand. Try again next time – each day is a new opportunity!
text: Ho ka ba thata ho dula o kgobile matshwafo ha dintho di tswa taolong. Leka hape kamoso – etswe matsatsi a tjhaba ka ho fapana!

SourceText: It sounds like you are having a difficult time with your child. This can be really hard so be patient with yourself. Try to take a pause (even one deep breath!) next time and respond differently. You can do it!
text: Ho utlwahala eka dintho ha di tsamaye hantle pakeng tsa hao le ngwana wa hao. Ena ekaba ntho e thata haholo kahoo imamelle. Leka ho phomola (leha e se e le ho phufumulohela hodimo hanngwe feela) kamoso mme o arabele ka tsela e sa tshwaneng. O ka atleha!

SourceText: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families now. How many days in the past week have you felt very worried or anxious about money? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ntho e nngwe e kgolohadi e hlobaetsang ka malapeng ke tjhelete. O qetile matsatsi a makae bekeng e fetileng o ikutlwa o kgathatsehile kapa o tshwenyehile haholo ka tjhelete? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?
text: Ke matsatsi a makae kgweding (matsatsi a 30) e fetileng o ileng wa haellwa ke tjhelete ya ho lefella dijo? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with a number between 0 and 30.
text: Ha ke tsebe hore na o bua kang. Ka kopo karabo ya hao e be palo e pakeng tsa 0 le 30.

SourceText: It can sometimes be difficult to have a positive relationship with our children. How confident do you feel about your ability as a parent/caregiver to have a positive relationship with your children? (0=not confident to 7=extremely confident)
text: Ka dinako tse ding ho ka ba thata ho ba le dikamano tse ntle le bana ba rona. O na le boitshepo bo bokae bo amanang le bokgoni ba hao jwaloka motswadi/mohlokomedi ba ho theha dikamano tse ntle le bana ba hao? (0=ha ke itshepe ho hang ho ya ho 7=ke itshepa ho tlola)

SourceText: Having a positive relationship with our children can be difficult, especially during stressful times. You might want to try spending a little more One-on-One Time with your child. It will show them that they are valued and loved.
text: Ho ba le dikamano tse ntle le bana ba rona ho ka ba thata, haholoholo dinakong tse boima. O ka nna wa batla ho leka ho qeta eketsa hanyane Nako ya Boinotshing le ngwana wa hao. Seo se tla mo bontsha hore ke motho wa bohlokwa le ya ratwang.

SourceText: It is so wonderful to hear that you are able to maintain a positive relationship with your children. They really benefit from having you as a source of love and support in their lives.
text: Ke ntho e tsotehang haholo ho utlwa hore o kgona ho ba le dikamano tse ntle le bana ba hao. Ka sebele ba fola molemo hobane o le mohlodi wa lerato le tshehetso bophelong ba bona.

SourceText: Bonus question: We all want to keep our children safe. In the past month, have you talked with your child about keeping safe from sexual violence online or offline? This could be when they are going out with friends, or talking about the websites they use.
text: Potso ya tlatsetso: Kaofela re batla ho tiisa hore bana ba rona ba sireletsehile. Kgweding e fetileng, na o kile wa buisana le ngwana wa hao ka ho itshireletsa diketsong tsa thobalano ka dikgoka inthaneteng kapa tse etswang ka ho toba? Sena se ka etsahala ha ba intsha le metswalle, kapa ho bua ka diwebosaete tseo ba di sebedisang.

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with either yes or no.
text: Ha ke tsebe hore na o bua kang. Ka kopo arabela ka ee kapa tjhe.

SourceText: How many days have you had a talk like this? ? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?
text: Ke ka matsatsi a makae le ileng la bua ka tsela ye? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. It can be difficult to know how to keep our children safe. We often feel powerless as parents in this, but we are here to support you!
text: Ha ho bonolo ho ba motswadi. Ho thata ho tseba hore na o ka tiisa jwang hore bana ba hao ba dula ba sireletsehile. Hangata re ikutlwa re se na matla jwaloka batswadi ntlheng ena, empa re teng ho o tshehetsa!

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. Well done for focusing on keeping your child safe.
text: Ha ho bonolo ho ba motswadi. O sebeditse ka ho ameha ka ho tiisa hore ngwana wa hao o sireletsehile.

SourceText: Well done for spending time with your child, it makes all the difference @fields.user_name!

SourceText: That is okay! Here is a list of some of the risks and dangers that you may encounter online:
text: Ho lokile! Mona ke lethathamo la mathata le dikotsi tse ka o hlahelang inthaneteng:

SourceText: • Adults targeting people for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Batho ba baholo ba tsomang batho ka merero ya thobalano ho social media, moo ba bapalang dipapadi, le dipolatefomong tsa ho romela melaetsa.

SourceText: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
text: • Mananeo a kotsi – a nang le diketso tsa dikgoka, ho hloya basadi, ho hloya batho ba tswang dinaheng tse ding, ho kgothalletsa ho ipolaya le ho itematsa, ditaba tsa mashano tse kgelosang, ditshwantsho tsa thobalano e etswang pontsheng

SourceText: • Sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos.
text: • Ho aba tlhahisoleseding ya botho le dinepe kapa divideo tsa thobalano.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other people and strangers.
text: • Ho tellwa ke batho ba bang le bao o sa ba tsebeng inthaneteng.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Here is a review on quick technical fixes:

SourceText: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
text: • Bulela SafeSearch ho sebadi sa hao ho ntsha dintho tsa batho ba baholo.

text: • Setapa mehato ya taolo ya motswadi.

SourceText: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
text: • Etsa setapo e bolokang ditaba tsa lekunutu ka thata diepong le dipapading tsa inthaneteng.

SourceText: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/
text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/

text: • Kwaehela di-webcam ha di sa sebediswe.

SourceText: This programme is for parents and caregivers like you (aged 18 or older).
text: Lenaneo lena ke la batswadi le bahlokomedi ba kang wena (ba dilemo di 18 ho ya hodimo).

SourceText: Over the next few weeks, you will receive messages to help you manage stress and maintain positive relationships at home.
text: Dibekeng tse mmalwa tse tlang, o tla amohela melaetsa e tla o thusa ho laola seterese le ho baballa dikamano tse ntle le ba lelapa.

SourceText: Your participation and any information you provide will be used anonymously by researchers to learn about how to better support families like yours.

SourceText: I know, it is hard to remember to give one instruction at a time. When we do it, our child is more likely to listen – so we can praise them even more!

SourceText: Name that tune
text: Bolela lebitso la pina eo

SourceText: First person gets to choose or sing a song.
text: Motho wa pele o kgetha kapa o bina pina.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder they can guess the singer).
text: Bohle ba tlameha ho bolela lebitso la pina eo (ho ba thatafalletsa le ho feta, ba ka bolela sebini).

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Wa pele wa ho le bolela eba moetapele ya latelang ya tla kgetha kapa a bine pina e latelang.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! How are you feeling?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! O ikutlwa jwang?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! How are you feeling?
text: Dumela! O ikutlwa jwang?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone.
text: Ke maswabi ho utlwa hore letsatsi la kajeno ha le o tsamaele hantle. Kannete ke ntho e tlwaelehileng ho ba le mathata nakong ena. Hopola hore ha o mong.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you get through the day!
text: Shebella video ena e tla o thusa ho sebetsana le letsatsi la kajeno!

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you get through the day!
text: Mamela molaetsa ona o tla o thusa ho sebetsana le letsatsi la kajeno!

SourceText: Here is a short activity that can help when you are feeling like needing some more support to get through the day.
text: Ntho e kgutshwane ke ena eo o ka e etsang ha o utlwa eka o hloka tshehetso e eketsehileng hore o sebetsane le letsatsi la kajeno.

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Hlokomela hore na ke eng e etsahalang ho wena hona jwale. O nahanang? Na o nahana dintho tse ntle kapa tse mpe? O ikutlwa jwang? Na o na le boikutlo bo botle kapa bo bobe? Mmele wa hao o ikutlwa jwang? Na o ikutlwa o tsisipane kapa o phutholohile?

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes. Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Dula o iketlile mme o kwale mahlo. Bua le pelo ya hao ka tsela e mosa le e bonolo. O ka nna wa batla ho beha letsoho le leng pelong kapa sefubeng sa hao. Ipolelle mantswe a latelang ka lentswe le tlaase:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text: Nka motsotswana o nahana ka ntho e o hlahetseng. Sheba hore na ha o ikutlwe ka tsela e fapaneng.

SourceText: May I be peaceful.
text: Ese eka nka ba le kgotso.

SourceText: May I be safe.
text: Ese eka nka sireletseha.

SourceText: May I be healthy.
text: Ese eka nka phela hantle.

SourceText: May I be happy.
text: Ese eka nka thaba.

SourceText: May there be love in my family.
text: Ese eka ho ka ba le lerato lelapeng la ka.

SourceText: May I feel loved.
text: Ese eka nka ikutlwa ke ratwa.

SourceText: If you ever need additional support to help you cope with any stress or other emotional difficulties, type "Help". Chat to you later @fields.user_name!

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried involving your partner when making decisions recently?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! Na morao tje o ile wa leka ho kenyelletsa molekane wa hao ha o etsa diqeto?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried involving your partner when making decisions recently?
text: Dumela! Na morao tje o ile wa leka ho kenyelletsa molekane wa hao ha o etsa diqeto?

SourceText: How was your experience?
text: O hlahetswe ke eng?

SourceText: That is fantastic!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate!

SourceText: Would you like to review the content on this?
text: Na o ka lakatsa ho lekola dikateng tsa yona?

SourceText: It can be difficult to find the time to ask our partners for their opinions when we are making decisions. Can you think of a time during the day when both you and your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening?
text: Ho ka ba thata ho fumana nako ya ho kopa maikutlo a balekane ba rona ha re etsa diqeto. Na o ka nahana ka nako ya motshehare ha wena le molekane wa hao le se maphathaphathe haholo, mohlomong dihoreng tsa hoseng kapa motshehare wa mantsiboya?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that your partner reacted negatively. Be proud of yourself for trying and be gentle with yourself. Remember you can always get extra support by typing "Help".
text: Ke maswabi ho utlwa hore molekane wa hao o ile a arabela hampe. Eba motlotlo ka wena hore o entse boiteko mme o inahanele. Hopola hore o ka fuwa thuso eo o e hlokang ha o thaepa “Thuso”.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to know how to involve your partner when making a decision. Sometimes all you need to do is to ask them what they think. This shows them you care and want them to be involved!
text: Ka dinako tse ding ho thata ho tseba hore na o ka kenyelletsa molekane wa hao jwang ha o etsa diqeto. Ka dinako tse ding seo o lokelang ho se etsa feela ke ho mo botsa hore na o nahana jwang? Sena se mo bontsha hore o a mo tsotella ebile o batla hore a kenelle tabeng!

SourceText: It can be hard to remember to involve our partners in decision making. If you forget, it’s important to try again! Asking them for their opinion shows them that you care and want them to be involved.
text: Ho ka ba thata ho hopola ho kenyelletsa balekane ba rona ha re etsa diqeto. Ha o lebetse, ho bohlokwa hore o leke hape! Ho kopa maikutlo a hae ho bontsha hore o a mo tsotella ebile o batla hore a kenelle.

SourceText: It can take time to get used to making decisions together. Give yourself time to adjust. Remember that by communicating with your partner and involving them in decision-making, they will start to feel more comfortable doing so too.
text: Ho ka nka nako hore le tlwaele ho etsa diqeto hammoho. Iphe nako ya ho fetoha. Hopola hore ha o buisana le molekane wa hao mme o mo kenyelletsa ha o etsa diqeto, le yena o tla qala ho ikutlwa a phutholohile ha a etsa jwalo.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear this. What did you find difficult when trying to involve your partner in making a decision?
text: Re maswabi ho utlwa seo. O ile wa thatafallwa ke eng ha o leka ho kenyelletsa molekane wa hao ha o etsa diqeto?

SourceText: I am sorry to hear this. What did you find difficult when trying to involve your partner in making a decision?
text: Ke maswabi ho utlwa seo. O ile wa thatafallwa ke eng ha o leka ho kenyelletsa molekane wa hao ha o etsa diqeto?

SourceText: That is okay! Remember you can access this content at anytime by typing "Help". Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Ho lokile! Hopola hore o ka fumana dintlha tsena neng kapa neng ka ho thaepa “Thuso”. Ke tla bua le wena hamorao @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That is okay! Remember you can access this content at anytime by typing "Help". Chat to you later!
text: Ho lokile! Hopola hore o ka fumana dintlha tsena neng kapa neng ka ho thaepa “Thuso”. Ke tla bua le wena hamorao!

SourceText: Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?
text: Dumela! O ikutlwa jwang hona jwale? Na o thabile, o hloname, o halefile, o tsohile molota, o kgathatsehile?

SourceText: Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.
text: Hlokomela hore hore na ke hokae moo o ikutlwang jwalo mmeleng wa hao. Hlokomela hore na boikutlo boo bo tsamaisana le menahano efe. Phefumulohela hodimo.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through a fun physical activity!
text: Mamela molaetsa ona o tla o tataisa hore o thabele ho ikwetlisa!

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up like you are reaching to the sky. Pretend to push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Ema mme o otlolle matsoho a hao jwalokaha eka o nanabela sepakapaka. Etsa eka o sututsa maru afe kapa afe mme o tlohele letsatsi le tjhabele hodima hao. Otlollela mahlakoreng ka bobedi. Ikotlollele kapele le ka morao.

SourceText: Here's a fun video of a physical activity that can help you release stress and keep healthy!
text: Shebella video ena e monate ya boikwetliso bo ka o thusang ho fokotsa seterese le ho dula o phetse hantle!

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears, scrunch your eyes and face, and hold your breath. Release your breath and then relax your shoulders and body.
text: Lepeletsa matsoho ka mahlakoreng. Ha o hula moya, atametsa mahetla a hao a kotlobane ditsebeng, sidila mahlo le sefahleho, mme o tshware moya. Phefumoloha ho lokolla moya mme o phomotse mahetla le mmele wa hao.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Phomotsa diphaka tsa hao mme o tlohele dipaka di lokotsehe ka mahlakoreng, ebe o reteletsa karolo e ka hodimo ya mmele. Diphaka tsa hao di tlameha ho kgitla habonolo kamorao ha o sothehela ka mahlakoreng.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beha leoto le leng kapela le leng mme o etse didikadikwe tse nyane tsa maqaqailana, hopola ho retelehela ka mahlakoreng ka bobedi. Etsa leoto ka leng didikadikwe tse nne lehlakore ka leng.

SourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Jwale tsukutla mmele wohle kapele kamoo o ka kgonang. O tsukutle o ya hodimo! O tsukutle o ya tlaase! O tsukutle ka mahlakoreng wohle!

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Kwala mahlo mme o phahamise diphaka butle ho ba hodima hlooho ya ha o ntse o hula moya. Thola diphaka tsa hao butle ho leba ka mahlakoreng ha o ntse o lokolla moya.

text: Na o ka thabela ho ikotlolla ka ditsela tse ding?

SourceText: Well done for trying! How was your experience?
text: O sebeditse ka boiteko ba hao! O hlahetswe ke eng?

SourceText: Sometimes it can be hard to find time during the day. Can you think of a time when you’re less busy? For example, maybe it is easier to help out with housework later in the evening when some of the children have gone to sleep. Try to see what works for you!
text: Ka dinako tse ding ho ka ba thata ho fumana nako motshehare. O nahana hore ke nakong efe ha o sa phathahana haholo? Ka mohlala, mohlomong ho bonolo ho phetha mesebetsi ya lapeng mantsiboya ha bana ba bang ba se ba robetse. Leka ho bona hore na ke eng e o sebeletsang!

SourceText: Ask them! By telling your partner you want to help out but don’t know how, you are showing them you care and are interested in being involved. This can also help family members understand each other better.
text: Ba botse! Ka ho bolella molekane wa hao hore o batla ho thusa empa ha o tsebe hore na o ka thusa jwang, o bontsha hore o a tsotella ebile o thahasella ho kenya letsoho. Sena se ka ba sa thusa ditho tsa lelapa ho utlwisisana hamolemo.

SourceText: It can be difficult to remember to ask others what they need help with. Once you start offering to help however, others may realise you want to be involved and may ask for help when they need it!
text: Ho ka ba thata ho hopola ho botsa hore na ba hloka ho thuswa ka eng. Empa ha o ithaopela ho thusa, batho ba bang baa bona hore o batla ho kenya letsoho mme ba ka kopa thuso ha ba e hloka!

SourceText: It can be hard to ask for help. Sometimes we expect our partners to know we need help even if we don’t ask them. Once you start telling however, they will likely start offering to help more often in the future.
text: Ho ka ba thata ho kopa thuso. Ka dinako tse ding re lebella hore balekane ba rona ba tsebe hore re hloka thuso esita leha re sa e kope. Empa ha o qala ho mo bolella hore o a e hloka, ho ka etsahala hore a ithaopele ho thusa hangata nakong e tlang.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself - trying something new is often hard at first! Give yourself time to adjust. Also remind yourself that helping your partner with these tasks benefits the whole family!
text: Inahanele - hangata ho thata ho leka ho etsa ntho e ntjha ka lekgetlo la pele! Iphe nako ya ho fetoha. Hape ikgopotse hore ho thusa molekane wa hao ka mesebetsi ena ho molemong wa lelapa lohle!

SourceText: It looks like you are facing an emergency. Can you please tell us what kind of assistance you require?
text: Ekare o tobane le boemo ba tshohanyetso. Ke kopa hore hle o mpolelle hore na o hloka thuso ya mofuta ofe.

SourceText: Type "SOS" at any time if you would like the details of any other emergency service or hotline. Remember everything you say will be completely private!
text: Thaepa “SOS” neng kapa neng haeba o lakatsa ho fumana dintlha tsa ditshebeletso dife kapa dife tse ding tsa boemo ba tshohanyetso kapa nomoro ya mohala. Hopola hore ntho tsohle tseo o tla di bua di tla bolokwa e le lekunutu!

SourceText: Let's take a pause together! Take a deep breath and ask yourself, "What am I thinking?"
text: A re ke re kgefutse hanyane mmoho! Phefumulohela hodimo mme o ipotse, “Ke nahana eng?”

SourceText: Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Whatever you are feeling, it is okay. Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: Hlokomela hore na o nahana dintho tse ntle kapa tse mpe. Hlokomela haeba maikutlo a hao ke a matle kapa a mabe. Hore na o ikutlwa jwang, ho lokile. Hlokomela hore na mmele wa hao o ikutlwa jwang. Hlokomela eng kapa eng e o lematsang kapa e utlwisang bohloko.

SourceText: Focus on your breath as it goes in and out. Do this for about 10 breaths.
text: Ameha ka ho phefumuloha ha hao ha moya o kena le ha o tswa. Phefumuloha ka makgetlo a isang ho a 10.

SourceText: Now, expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: Jwale ela hloko mmele wohle wa hao. Mamela medumo e ka phapusing.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different.
text: Ka motsotswana imamele mme o utlwe hore na ho na le phapang.

SourceText: Here's a video about how to keep calm and manage stress in our busy lives.
text: Shebella video ena ya tsela ya ho dula re kgobile matshwafo le ho laola seterese bophelong ba rona bo maphathaphathe.

SourceText: Taking a Pause is a simple relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried. It can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong.
text: Ho Kgefutsa ke tsela e bonolo ya ho phomola eo o ka e etsang neng kapa neng ha o ikutlwa o imetswe kapa o kgathatsehile. Hape e ka o thusa ha o fumana hore ngwana wa hao o a o tena kapa o etsa ntho e fosahetseng.

SourceText: Here is a comic to remind you of taking a pause!
text: Ena ke tsela ya boswaswi e re hopotsang ho kgefutsa hanyane!

SourceText: “How am I going to get through this?”
text: “Ke tla hlola bothata boo jwang?”

SourceText: “Whatever it is, I am okay.”
text: “Ha ho na taba, ho lokile.”

SourceText: “Breathe in. Breathe out."
text: “Hula moya. Lokolla moya.

SourceText: “I can do this. We will get through it together.”
text: “O ka atleha. Re tla feta boemong bona hammoho.”

SourceText: Chat later!
text: A re bue hamorao!

SourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause @fields.user_name. You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a pause whenever you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your Child!
text: O sebeditse ka ho Nka Kgefu @fields.user_name. O ekeditse boiphihlelo bo bong Mokotleng wa hao wa Dithulusi tsa Botswadi! Matsatsing a mmalwa a tlang, leka ho kgefutsa neng kapa neng ha o ikutlwa o imetswe. Seo se o fa monyetla wa ho kgoba matshwafo le ho feta. Esita le ho phefumoloha ka makgetlo a mmalwa kapa ho fumana kamano pakeng tsa hao le lefatshe leo o emeng hodima lona ho ka tlisa phapang e kgolo. Hape o ka Nka Kgefu le Ngwana wa hao!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

text: Na o ka thabela ho qala qalong kapa ho qala moo o kgaoditseng lenaneo lena teng lekgetlong la ho qetela?

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! Na o kgonne ho qeta metsotso e 5 kapa ho feta ya Nako ya Boinotsing le ngwana wa hao kajeno?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Dumela! Na o kgonne ho qeta metsotso e 5 kapa ho feta ya Nako ya Boinotsing le ngwana wa hao kajeno?

SourceText: Wonderful! Spending One-on-One Time with your children may make them more willing to help out more often. You are doing great!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate! Ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le bana ba hao ho ka nna ha etsa hore ba ikemisetse ho thusa ka makgetlo a mangata. O etsa mosebetsi o tswileng matsoho!

SourceText: We understand that spending One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult. Here are some of the main reasons parents struggle. Which one is the closest to you?
text: Rea utlwisisa hore ka dinako tse ding ho ka ba thata ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing. A mang a mabaka a maholo a etsang hore ho be thata ho batswadi ke ana. Ke lefe le o amang haholo?

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more? You can even make household chores into a game to do together. Even 5 minutes can make a big difference!
text: Ho ka ba thata ho fumana nako motshehare, ka mosebetsi, mesebetsi ya lelapa le dintho tsohle tseo re tlamehang ho di etsa. O nahana hore ke neng letsatsi le letsatsi o ka behellang ka thoko metsotso e 5 kapa ho feta? Hape le ka fetola mesebetsi ya lelapa papadi eo le e bapalang mmoho. Esita le metsotso e 5 e ka etsa phapang e kgolo!

SourceText: Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).
text: Hangata bana ba batla ho qeta nako ba shebeletse T.V. kapa ba bapala ka disebediswa. Ka dinako tse ding o ka nna wa batla ho ba fa dintho tse ding tseo ba ka thabelang ho di etsa (Thaepa: “Thuso” haeba o batla keletso).

SourceText: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
text: O ka nna wa se thabe ha bana ba hao ba sa batle ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le wena. Nahana hantle: Ke neng moo ba ka thabelang ho o phetlela sefuba? Mohlomong hoseng kapa pele ba robala.

SourceText: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").
text: Dipapadi tseo ho hlodisanwang di ka ba thata bakeng sa bana (le batho ba baholo!) haeba ba sa kgone ho amohela ho hlolwa. O ka nna wa batla ho sisinya dipapadi tse ding tseo le ka di babalang mmoho ho fapana le ho di bapala le le ba direng (Thaepa “Thuso” haeba o batla dikeletso).

SourceText: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.
text: Ka dinako tse ding bana ba rona ba tla sisinya dipapadi tsa diketso tsa dikgoka kapa tse sa bolokehang. Ba hlalosetse hore na ke hobaneng ha le ke ke la di bapala, mme o leka ho ba bontsha dipapadi tse ding tse loketseng. Thaepa “Thuso” haeba o batla keletso.

SourceText: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.
text: Ho ka ba thata ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le ngwana ka mong ha o na le bana ba babedi ho ya hodimo. Ha ho kgoneha, o ka kopa motho e mong e moholo kapa abuti kapa ausi wa bona ho sheba bana ba bang ha o qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le ngwana e mong.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!
text: Re maswabi ho utlwa hore o na le mathata a ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le bana ba hao. Ka kopo thaepa “Thuso” bakeng sa dikeletso tse ding tseo o ka nnang wa di sebedisa. Rea leboha ka ho leka sohle se matleng a hao!

SourceText: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.
text: Hape o ka naha ka dinako tseo ho ka bang bonolo ho qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le ngwana ka mong, jwaloka ho qeta nako le ngwana e moholwanyane mantsiboya ha ba bang ba se ba robetse.

SourceText: You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once!
text: Hape o ka qeta Nako ya Boinotsing le bana bohle ba hao ka nako e le nngwe!

SourceText: Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family
text: Thaepa “Thuso” bakeng sa mesebetsi eo le ka e etsang le le lelapa lohle

SourceText: If @fields.child_nickname is too young to understand how long a minute is, then you can set a number of time to repeat the activity: "5 more tries and then it will be time for wash our hands before dinner…"

SourceText: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank @fields.child_nickname for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect @fields.child_nickname to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.

SourceText: Today's tip is about spending One-on-One Time with Our Children.
text: Keletso ya kajeno ke ho qeta Nako ya Boinotshing le Bana ba Rona.

SourceText: Children learn through play! Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your baby!
text: Bana ba ithuta ka ho bapala! Ena ke tsela ya boswaswi ya ho qeta nako ya boinotshing le lesea la hao!

SourceText: Parent: "Such a strong baby you are."
text: Motswadi: “O ngwana ya matla hakaakang!”

SourceText: Parent: "We are making a delicious meal together."
text: Motswadi: “Re etsa dijo tse monate re le babedi.”

SourceText: Parent: “Here I am?”
text: Motswadi: “Ke nna enwa!”

SourceText: Baby: "Ha ha ha!"
text: Lesea: "Ha ha ha!"

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You have stacked 3 blocks on top of each other. Well done!"
text: Motswadi: “Sisi! O hahile diboloko tse 3 ka ho di kolohanya. Mosebetsi o tswileng matsoho!”

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!).Would you like to review it again?
text: Rea tseba hore o se o ntse o fumane keletso ena (o sebeditse!) Na o ka thabela ho e lekola hape?

SourceText: Invest in One-on-One Time! The more time you spend with your children, the more likely they will listen to you and behave well at other times. It really works!
text: Qeta Nako e ngata ya Boinotsing! Ha o qeta nako e ngata le bana ba hao, ho na le menyetla e mengata ya hore ba o mamele mme ba itshware hantle ka dinako tse ding. Kannete e a sebetsa!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to receive more tips about how to manage your child's behaviour.
text: O ska kgathatseha! O ka thaepa “Thuso” kamehla haeba o ka thabela ho fumana dikeletso tse ding tsa ho laola boitshwaro ba ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.
text: Matsatsing a pele a 1000 a bophelo ke monyetla o hlahileng wa hore lesea la hao le ithute. Ke nakong eo boko ba lona bo holang ka potlako ho feta neng kapa neng bophelong ba lona. Ha o qeta nako le lesea la hao, o tiisa dikamano tse mofuthu pakeng tsa lona tse tla etsa hore le ikutlwe le sireletsehile ebile le ratwa.

SourceText: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:
text: Bona dikeletso tse bonolo tse 7 tsa ho etsa hore Nako ya Boinotshing le lesea la hao e atlehe:

SourceText: 1. Do it every day
text: 1. E qete letsatsi le letsatsi

SourceText: 2. Be close to your baby
text: 2. Eba haufi le lesea la hao

SourceText: 3. Let your baby take the lead
text: 3. Tlohela lesea la hao le etelle pele

SourceText: 4. Observe and listen to your child
text: 4. Shebella le ho mamela ngwana wa hao

SourceText: 5. Play with your baby
text: 5. Bapala le lesea la hao

SourceText: 6. Talk to your baby
text: 6. Buisana le lesea la hao

SourceText: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
text: 7. O ka ba le nako ya boleng le lesea la hao neng kapa neng!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Hore o ithute haholwanyane ka dikeletso tsena, thaepa “1” ho ya ho “7”. Hape o ka thaepa "N" ho fetela pele.

SourceText: 2. Be close to your child.
text: 2. Eba haufi le ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.
text: Ho bohlokwa haholo ho thetsana le bana ba qetang ho hlaha le masea ka letlalo. Ha e le bana ba ithutang ho tsamaya, tiisa hore o ba boemong bo lekanang le ba bona.

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!
text: Bana ba tlameha ho etsa dintho ka nako ya bona. Leka ho ba fa nako ya ho ithuta mme o be le mamello. Hopola hore lefatshe ke ntho e ntjha-tjha! ho ngwana wa hao!

SourceText: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing. Here is a comic on how to communicate with your baby.
text: Sebedisa mantswe ho hlalosa diketso, mebala, dibopeho, dipalo, boholo, kamoo dintho di utlwahalang kateng, dithemphereitjhara, ditatso, medumo, le eng kapa eng e etsahalang. Bua ka tjheseho ha o hlalosa ntho eo ngwana wa hao a e etsang. Ena ke tsela ya boswaswi ya ho buisana le lesea la hao.

SourceText: Parent: "You are such a beautiful person"
text: Motswadi: “O motho e motle - pabala ya nnete”

SourceText: Parent: "Buh, buh, buh, big baby!"
text: Motswadi: “Ngwa, ngwa, ngwa, ngwana e moholo!”

SourceText: Baby: "Buh, buh, buh…"
text: Lesea: “Ngwa, ngwa, ngwa...”

SourceText: Parent: "And then there were two green parrots in the mango tree!"
text: Motswadi: "Ho ne ho na le dipopokgae tse pedi tse tala sefateng sa manko!"

SourceText: Parent: "And now I am cleaning your toes, and your feet, and your knees…"
text: Motswadi: “Jwale ke hlwekisa menwana ya hao ya maoto, le maoto a hao, le mangole a hao...”

SourceText: It is normal for men of the family to struggle to think of what to do with their babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.
text: Ke ho tlwalehileng hore banna ba nang le malapa ba qakehe hore na ba tla etsang le masea a bona, haholoholo ha eka mosebetsi wa wona ke ho ja, ho robala, ho lla, le ho kaka feela. Ho ka ba thata ka ho kgetheha ha ngwana asale monyane haholo mme a sa kgone ho bua le wena.

SourceText: It is normal for mothers to struggle to think of what to do with their babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.

SourceText: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.

SourceText: 1. Do it every day!
text: 1. E qete letsatsi le letsatsi!

SourceText: Try to spend time playing with @fields.child_nickname every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.
text: Leka ho qeta nako o bapala le @fields.child_nickname letsatsi le letsatsi bonyane ka metsotso e 20 moo o shebaneng le yena feela. Kgetha nako eo ho se nang monyetla o mokaalo wa hore o sitiswe. Tima thelevishene mme o behelle difouno hole.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to spend time playing with your baby every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.
text: Leka ho qeta nako o bapala le lesea la hao letsatsi le letsatsi bonyane ka metsotso e 20 moo o shebaneng le yena feela. Kgetha nako eo ho se nang monyetla o mokaalo wa hore o sitiswe. Tima thelevishene mme o behelle difouno hole.

SourceText: 4. Observe your child.
text: 4. Sheba ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: See what facial expressions @fields.child_nickname is making. Notice what @fields.child_nickname is interested in or looking at.

SourceText: See what facial expressions your child is making. Notice what your child is interested in or looking at.

SourceText: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If @fields.child_nickname gets frustrated, you can reassure @fields.child_nickname by gently stroking their back.
text: Fana ka tshehetso e lekaneng ho thusa ngwana ho fihlella katleho. Ho lokile ho bapalla kantle le ho kopitsa seo a se etsang empa leka ho mo tlohela ebe yena ya qalang ntho eo a batlang ho e etsa. Haeba @fields.child_nickname a teneha, o ka tsosa @fields.child_nickname molota ka ho mo phathatsa hanyane ka mokokotlong.

SourceText: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let @fields.child_nickname use all of their senses when exploring the world. SourceText: Start talking to @fields.child_nickname from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know @fields.child_nickname can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-one time with your child.
text: Ena ke tsela ya boswaswi ya ho qeta nako ya boinotshing le lesea la hao!

SourceText: Child: “I’m bored! There is nothing to do.”
text: Ngwana: “Ke boreile! Ha ho na ntho eo nka e etsang.”

SourceText: Parent: “Let’s do something together! How about we make some drawings and put them on the gate with messages for people to see?”
text: Motswadi: “Tloo re etse ntho e nngwe re le babedi! Ho ka ba jwang ha re ka toroya ditshwantsho mme re di behe keiteng di na le melaetsa hore batho ba di bone?”

SourceText: Children: “Okay!”
text: Bana: “Ke hantle!”

SourceText: Parent: “You make the pictures and I’ll write the messages”
text: Motswadi: “O toroye ditshwantsho mme ke tla ngola melaetsa”

SourceText: Child: “Sure!”
text: Ngwana: “Ho lokile!”

SourceText: Parent: "Remember to wash hands! We love our neighbours!”
text: Motswadi: “Hopola ho hlapa matsoho! Re rata baahelani ba rona!”

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! Na morao tjena o kile wa leka ho aba boikarabelo ba lelapa lapeng?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Dumela! Na morao tjena o kile wa leka ho aba boikarabelo ba lelapa lapeng?

SourceText: This can be hard to remember! Establishing a routine around caregiving or housework tasks can sometimes be helpful. This also lets you talk to your partner or other adults about how to share the workload.
text: Ho ka ba thata ho hopola ho etsa jwalo! Ka dinako tse ding ho ba le mokgwa o latelwang wa ho phetha mesebetsi ya ho hlokomela ba lelapa le mesebetsi ya katlung ho ka thusa. Sena se bile se o fa monyetla wa ho buisana le molekane wa hao kapa batho ba bang ba baholo ka ho thusana ka mosebetsi wa ka lapeng.

SourceText: It is hard to remember to ask for help. Be kind to yourself if you forget to ask and try again another time. Asking for help and sharing family responsibilities benefits the whole family!
text: Ho thata ho hopola ho etsa jwalo. Iqenehele haeba o lebetse ho ba kopa mme o leke hape ka nako e nngwe. Ho kopa thuso le ho aba boikarabelo ba lelapa ho tlisetsa lelapa lohle melemo!

SourceText: It can be difficult to know how to ask for help. Try starting off with suggesting a task you would like help with. Being specific gives your partner a clearer idea of what they can support you with.
text: Ho thata ho tseba tsela ya ho kopa thuso. Qala ka ho etsa tshisinyo ya hore le etse mosebetsi oo o ka thabelang ho thuswa ka wona. Ho toba taba ho hlakisetsa molekane wa hao  hore na a ka o thusa ka eng.

SourceText: Trying something new can be hard! To make it easier, ask your partner to do it together with you the first few times. Soon you’ll feel more confident doing it on your own!
text: Ho leka ntho e ntjha ho ka ba thata! Ho nolofatsa dintho, kopa molekane wa hao hore le e etse mmoho ka makgetlo a qalang a mmalwa. Ho eso ye kae o tla ba le boitshepo ho e etsa o le mong!

SourceText: Talk to them! Talking with your partner about how you can share family responsibilities helps both of you understand each other better. It also shows that you care!
text: Bua le yena! Ho buisana le molekane wa hao ka tsela eo le ka thusanang ka mesebetsi ya lelapa ho ka le thusa ka bobedi ho utlwisisana hamolemo. Hape seo se bontsha hore le a tsotella!

SourceText: It can be difficult to find time during the day sometimes! Can you think of a time when your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening? Creating a routine around housework can also be helpful.
text: Ka dinako tse ding ho ka ba thata ho fumana nako motshehare. Na o ka nahana ka nako ya ha molekane wa hao a se maphathaphathe, jwaloka dihoreng tsa hoseng kapa motshehare wa mantsiboya? Ho etsa lenaneo la mosebetsi wa lapeng ho ka ba molemo.

SourceText: Sharing responsibilities in the home benefits everyone! While trying something new can feel hard at first, soon you will start to feel more comfortable. If it helps, ask your partner to join you in the beginning!
text: Bohle ba fumana melemo ha mesebetsi ya lelapa e abuwa. Leha ho leka ntho e ntjha ho ka ba thata qalong, kamora nako e kgutshwanyane o tla qala ho ikutlwa o phutholohile haholo. Haeba sena se ka o thusa, kopa molekane wa hao ho sebetsa le wena qalong!

SourceText: Excellent job @fields.user_name! Sharing the workload benefits the whole family. How was your experience?
text: Kgau e a o tshwanela @fields.user_name! Ho thusana ka mesebetsi ho tswela lelapa lohle molemo. O hlahetswe ke eng?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Excellent job! Sharing the workload benefits the whole family. How was your experience?
text: Kgau e a o tshwanela! Ho thusana ka mesebetsi ho tswela lelapa lohle molemo. O hlahetswe ke eng?

SourceText: We are sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Re maswabi ho utlwa seo. O ne o thatafallwa ke eng tabeng ya ho aba mesebetsi ya lalapa?

SourceText: I am sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Ke maswabi ho utlwa seo. O ne o thatafallwa ke eng tabeng ya ho aba mesebetsi ya lalapa?

SourceText: Hi! Thank you for signing up to receive ParentText tips. Please tell us which language you would like:
text: Dumela! Rea leboha ka hore o saenele ho fumana dikeletso tsa ParentText. Ke kopa o re bolelle hore na o ka rata ho di fumana ka puo efe:

SourceText: Hi! Thank you for signing up to receive ParentText tips. Please tell me which language you would like:
text: Dumela! Rea leboha ka hore o saenele ho fumana dikeletso tsa ParentText. Ke kopa o mpolelle hore na o ka rata ho di fumana ka puo efe:

SourceText: How did you find out about ParentText?
text: O tsebile ka ParentText jwang?

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the Sunshine of Positive Attention shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Ema mme o otlolle matsoho a hao sepakapakeng. Apola maru afe kapa afe mme o tlohelle Letsatsi la Mahlohonolo le tjhabele hodima hao. Otlollela mahlakoreng ka bobedi. Ikotlollele kapele le ka morao.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles. Remember to turn your foot to both sides - to the left and then to the right. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beha leoto le leng kapela le leng mme o etse didikadikwe tse nyane tsa maqaqailana. Hopola ho retelehetsa leoto la hao ka mahlakoreng ka bobedi - ka ho le letshehadi le ka ho le letona. Etsa leoto ka leng didikadikwe tse nne lehlakore ka leng.

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders up to your ears, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you breathe out and relax your body.
text: Lepeletsa matsoho ka mahlakoreng. Ha o hula moya, atametsa mahetla a hao a kotlobane ditsebeng, sidila mahlo le sefahleho, mme o tshware moya. Lepeletsa mahetla a hao ha o ntse o lokolla moya mme o qhanolotse mmele.

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. Repeat 4 times.
text: Kwala mahlo mme o phahamise diphaka butle ho ba hodima hlooho ya ha o ntse o hula moya. Thola diphaka tsa hao butle ho leba ka mahlakoreng ha o ntse o lokolla moya. Pheta sena ka makgetlo a 4.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take 4 deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
text: Diphaka tsa hao di phutholohe mme o di foke ho ya kapele ke ka morao. Hemela hodimo ka makgetlo a 4 ha o ntse o etsa sena. Sena se molemong wa karolo e ka morao ya letheka la hao.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways as you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Phomotsa diphaka tsa hao mme o tlohele dipaka di fokele ka mahlakoreng, ha o ntse o reteletsa karolo e ka hodimo ya mmele. Diphaka tsa hao di tlameha ho kgitla habonolo kamorao ha o sothehela ka mahlakoreng.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Nka motsotswana o nahana ka ntho e o hlahetseng. Hopola hore o ka etsa sena neng kapa neng ha o utlwa eka o hloka ho fokotsa seterese le ho matlafatsa kelello le mmele wa hao.

SourceText: How helpful was this tip?
text: Keletso ena e bile molemo hakae?

SourceText: How helpful was this activity?
text: Mosebetsi ona o bile molemo hakae?

text: Na o ikutlwa o imolohile seterese bophelong ba hao kamora ho ikotlolla ka ditsela tsee?

text: Na keletso ena e o thusitse?

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried resolving conflict in a calm way even when you have felt frustrated recently?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! Na morao tjena o kile wa rarolla phapang o kgobile matshwafo leha o ne o utlwa o tenehile?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried resolving conflict in a calm way even when you have felt frustrated recently?
text: Dumela! Na morao tjena o kile wa rarolla phapang o kgobile matshwafo leha o ne o utlwa o hore o tenehile?

SourceText: Sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about resolving conflicts between you and your partner?
text: Ke maswabi ho utlwa seo. Ke eng e ileng ya o thatafalletsa ho rarolla diphapang pakeng tsa hao le molekane wa hao?

SourceText: It can be really hard to stay calm when we’re having a disagreement with others. Try to think of something that you can do that might help like taking a couple deep breaths.
text: Kannete ho ka ba boima hore re dula re kgobile matshwafo ha re sa dumellane le batho ba bang. Leka ho nahana ka ntho eo o ka e etsang e ka nnang ya o thusa jwaloka ho phefumulohela hodimo ka makgetlo a mmalwa.

SourceText: It can be easy to forget, but don’t give up! Next time when you start feeling angry, try taking a deep breath before responding. You can also try walking away for a bit if you start feeling frustrated.
text: Ho ka ba bonolo ho lebala, empa o ska tela! Nakong e tlang ha o utlwa eka o tla halefa, leka ho phefumulohela hodimo pele o arabela. Hape o ka leka ho tloha sebakeng seo hanyane haeba o qala ho ikutlwa o tenehile.

SourceText: By taking a pause before responding, it can help us stay calm and respond better. When you feel yourself getting angry, try taking a pause. You can do this!
text: Ka ho nka kgefu pele re araba, seo se ka re thusa ho dula re kgutsitse le ho araba ka tsela e molemo. Ha o ikutlwa eka o a halefa, leka ho phefumulohela hodimo. O ka atleha!

SourceText: Sometimes others respond to us negatively when we’re having a disagreement. In these situations, it is sometimes best to walk away for a bit until those involved have calmed down.
text: Ka dinako tse ding batho ba re arabela hampe ha re sa dumellane. Maemong ana, ka dinako tse ding ho molemo ho tloha sebakeng seo ka nakwana ho fihlela ba amehang ba theotse moya.

SourceText: Good job @fields.user_name! Resolving conflicts isn’t always easy. How was your experience?
text: O sebeditse @fields.user_name! Hase kamehla ho leng bonolo ho rarolla diphapang. O hlahetswe ke eng?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Good job! Resolving conflicts isn’t always easy. How was your experience?

SourceText: Having a loving relationship with our partner can have a big impact on how we feel. It also helps make our children feel loved and safe.
text: Ho re le kamano e lerato le balekane ba rona, seo se ka ama tsela eo re ikutlwang ka yona haholo. Hape seo se etsa hore bana ba rona ba ikutlwe ba ratwa ebile ba sireletsehile.

SourceText: Here’s a video on how you can develop a loving and peaceful relationship with your partner!
text: Shebella video ena e bontshang kamoo o ka bang le kamano e lerato le e nang le kgotso le molekane wa hao!

SourceText: Here’s an audio message on how you can develop a loving and peaceful relationship with your partner!
text: Mamela molaetsa ona o mamelwang o bontshang kamoo o ka bang le kamano e lerato le e nang le kgotso le molekane wa hao!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" at anytime if you need any support with relationships with your partner or other adults. Chat to you later!
text: O ska kgathatseha! Neng kapa neng o ka thaepa “Thuso” haeba o hloka tshehetso efe kapa efe ka kamano ya hao le molekane wa hao kapa batho ba bang ba baholo. Ke tla bua le wena hamorao!

SourceText: Here are 5 simple tips on how you can develop a loving and peaceful relationship with your partner:
text: Bona dikeletso tsena tse 5 tse bonolo tse bontshang kamoo o ka bang le kamano e lerato le e nang le kgotso le molekane wa hao!

SourceText: 1. Treat each other as equals
text: 1. Tshwaranang jwaloka batho ba lekanang

SourceText: 2. Become a confident father and a supportive partner
text: 2. Eba ntate ya ka tshepelwang makunutu le molekane ya tshehetsang

SourceText: 3. Share family responsibilities
text: 3. Kenya letsoho ha ho phethwa mesebetsi ya lelapa

SourceText: 4. Resolve conflict peacefully
text: 4. Rarolla diphapang ka kgotso

SourceText: 5. Listen and talk to each other
text: 5. Mamelanang mme le buisane

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Thaepa “1” ho ya ho “5” hore o ithute haholwanyane ka dikeletso tsena. Thaepa “N” ho emisa keletso ena.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try using some of these tips in your relationships with your partner. Having a loving relationship with your partner can have a big impact on how you feel and can also help your children feel loved and safe!
text: O sebeditse ka ho eketsa boiphihlelo bo bong Mokotleng wa hao wa Dithulusi tsa Botswadi! Matsatsing a seng makae a tlang, leka ho sebedisa tse ding tsa dikeletso tsena dikamanong tsa hao le molekane wa hao. Ho ba le dikamano tse lerato le molekane wa hao ho ka ama tsela eo o ikutlwang ka yona haholo hape ho ka thusa bana ba lona hore ba ikutlwe ba ratwa ebile ba sireletsehile!

SourceText: Did you manage to establish ONE rule or daily routine together with your child or teen ?
text: Na o kgonne ho qala molao o le MONG kapa mokgwa wa letsatsi le letsatsi mmoho le ngwana kapa motjha wa hao

SourceText: Great to hear it this! Remember, the more we involve our children in setting rules, the more our children will be likely to follow them!
text: Ke thabela ho utlwa ditaba tseo! Hopola hore ha re kenyelletsa bana ba rona haholo ha ho etswa melao, ho na le menyetla e mengata ya hore bana ba rona ba e latele!

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to establish a rule or routine together?
text: Na le bile le diphephetso dife kapa dife ha le leka ho etsa molao kapa mokgwa oo lelapa le o latelang?

SourceText: It is always important when establishing rules and routines  as a family to consider the age of each child, so you can come up with age-appropriate routines. This is most important for bedtime, time to come home/play, household chores.
text: Ke habohlokwa hore ka dinako tsohle ha le etsa melao le ho qala mekgwa ya lelapa ho nahana ka dilemo tsa ngwana ka mong, e le hore le ka qala mekgwa e dumellanang le dilemo tsa ngwana. Sena se bohlokwa haholo bakeng sa nako ya ho robala, nako ya ho fihla lapeng/ho bapala, mesebetsi ya lelapa.

SourceText: We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, they more they will follow the rules too. You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their responsibilities (for example school or work activities).
text: Ka dinako tsohle re lokela ho hopola hore bana ba ithuta hantle ho rona. Ha re latela melao haholo, le bona ba tla latela melao. O ka fetola molao ho tiisa hore ho ka kgoneha hore bohle ba o latele, ho nahannwe ka boikarabelo ba bona (ka mohlala mesebetsi ya sekolong kapa ya boiphediso).

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children or teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Ha re etsa melao hammoho le bana kapa batjha ba rona, seo se thusa ditho tsa lelapa ho utlwisisana habetere. Etlaba melao e utlwahalang le ho feta mme bana ba tla ikemisetsa ho latela molao ebile ba tla kgona ho o latela.

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Ha re etsa melao hammoho le bana ba rona, seo se thusa ditho tsa lelapa ho utlwisisana habetere. Etlaba melao e utlwahalang le ho feta mme bana ba tla ikemisetsa ho latela molao ebile ba tla kgona ho o latela.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with @fields.child_nickname and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
text: Re maswabi hore ebe ha o eso kgone ho etsa sena. Dula fatshe le @fields.child_nickname mme o leke hape kajeno - ho kenyelletsa bana ho tla etsa hore ba batle ho latela molao haholo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with your child or teen  and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
