text: Ke eng e o thatafalletseng ka ho etsa molao kapa mokgwa oo le o latelang le ngwana kapa motjha wa hao?

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make @fields.child_nickname feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate! Melao le mekgwa e sa fetofetoheng e thusa @fields.child_nickname hore a ikutlwe a sireletsehile. Hape e etsa hore ba ikutlwe ba sireletsehile!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make your child or teen  feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Ke ditaba tse monate! Melao le mekgwa e sa fetofetoheng e thusa ngwana kapa motjha hore a ikutlwe a sireletsehile. Hape e etsa hore ba ikutlwe ba sireletsehile!

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a father It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Ho utlwa sello sa lesea ekaba ntho e sithabetsang maikutlo haholo, haholoholo ho ntate Ruri ke ntho e tlwaelehileng ho batla ho mo thodisa. O ka ba wa nahana hore mohlomong ha o motswadi wa mmakgonthe kapa hore lesea la hao le lla ho o qholotsa. Empa masea wohle aa lla. Ke e nngwe ya ditsela tse ka sehloohong tseo ka tsona ngwana a ka o bolellang hore dintho ha di tsamaye hantle.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a mother. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Ho utlwa sello sa lesea ekaba ntho e sithabetsang maikutlo hahholo, haholoholo ho mme. Ruri ke ntho e tlwaelehileng ho batla ho le thodisa. O ka ba wa nahana hore mohlomong ha o motswadi wa mmakgonthe kapa hore lesea la hao le lla ho o qholotsa. Empa masea wohle aa lla. Ke e nngwe ya ditsela tse ka sehloohong tseo ka tsona ngwana a ka o bolellang hore dintho ha di tsamaye hantle.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a parent. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Ho utlwa sello sa lesea ekaba ntho e sithabetsang maikutlo hahholo, haholoholo ho motswadi. Ruri ke ntho e tlwaelehileng ho batla ho le thodisa. O ka ba wa nahana hore mohlomong ha o motswadi wa mmakgonthe kapa hore lesea la hao le lla ho o qholotsa. Empa masea wohle aa lla. Ke e nngwe ya ditsela tse ka sehloohong tseo ka tsona ngwana a ka o bolellang hore dintho ha di tsamaye hantle.

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!). Would you like to review it again?
text: Kea tseba hore o se o ntse o fumane keletso ena (o sebeditse!) Na o ka lakatsa ho e lekola hape?

SourceText: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
text: Dinnete tse 2, Mafosisa a 1

SourceText: Think of three statements about yourself. Two must be true and one must be a lie.
text: Nahana ka dipolelo tsena tse tharo tse amanang le wena. Tse pedi tsa tsona ke nnete mme e le nngwe e tlameha ho ba mafosisa.

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, I love ice cream and I really wish I could sing.
text: E tlameha ebe ke ntho e thusang ho nahana ka ditakatso, dintho tseo motho a di ratang kapa tseo a sa di rateng. Ka mohlala, ke hloile dibanana, ke rata aeskrimi mme kannete ke lakatsa eka nka bina.

SourceText: Say them to your partner or friends. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Di bolelle molekane kapa metswalle ya hao. Ba kope hore ba bolele hore na ke efe eo e leng mafosisa.

SourceText: Did they guess correctly? Was it a surprise?
text: Na ba nepile? Na ba o makaditse?

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Ba kope o etse se tshwanang ho bona. Na wena le bona le ithutile ntho e ntjha e mong ka e mong?

SourceText: Crazy Chicken
text: Dikgoho tsa Mohlolo

SourceText: Shake your hand in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Tsoka letsoho la hao moyeng ka makgetlo a 8 o ntse o bala ho fihlela ho 8

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can
text: Etsa sena kapele kamoo o ka kgonang o phahamisitse lentswe kahohle kamoo o ka kgonang

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand and both feet
text: Pheta sena ka letsoho le leng le ka maoto ka bobedi

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times until you get to 1.
text: Etsa sena ka makgetlo a 7 , ebe makgetlo a 6 ho fihlela o fihla ho le 1.

SourceText: Call out “Crazy chicken” as loud as you can!
text: Hweletsa o re “Dikgoho tsa Mohlolo” ka lentswe le phahamang kamoo o ka kgonang!

SourceText: Have you released all your stress? If not, do it again even faster and louder!
text: Na seterese sohle sa hao se tswile? Haeba ho se jwalo, etsa jwalo hape ebile e le ka lebelo le lentswe le phahameng le ho feta!

SourceText: Family Work Out
text: Boithapollo ba Lelapa

SourceText: Choose a sport or exercise to do together
text: Kgetha papadi kapa boikwetliso boo le ka bo etsang mmoho

SourceText: Decide on a schedule. Are you going to do it every day? For how long?
text: Kgethang nako. Na etlaba letsatsi le letsatsi? Ka nako e kae?

SourceText: Try it out for a week.
text: Lekang seo ka beke.

SourceText: At the end of the week, ask yourself and your family these questions. How’s it going? How did you feel at the start of the week? How do you feel at the end of the week? What can we do differently next week?
text: Qetellong ya beke, ipotse dipotso tsena mme o botse le ba lelapa la hao dipotso tsena. Ho jwang? Le ne le ikutlwa jwang ha beke e qala? Le ikutlwa jwang ha beke e fela? Re ka etsa eng ka tsela e fapaneng bekeng e tlang?

SourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our children's education with school closures and remote learning. It is normal to feel overwhelmed about to do this alone, especially when we also have stress about work and money.
text: COVID-19 e sitisitse thuto ya bana ba rona ka hore ho kwalwe dikolo mme ba ithutele malapeng. Ke ntho e tlwaelehileng ho ikutlwa o imetswe ha o lokela ho etsa sena o le mong, haholoholo ha re na le seterese sa mosebetsi le tjhelete.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more about how to support your children with remote learning and returning to school?
text: Na o ka thabela ho ithuta haholwanyane ka tsela ya ho tshehetsa bana ba hao ka ho ithuta ba le malapeng le ho kgutlela sekolong?

SourceText: Stop & Listen
text: Ema mme o Mamele

SourceText: • Stop for a moment and close your eyes.
text: • Ema hanyane mme o kwale mahlo.

SourceText: • How many sounds can you hear? Listen to sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: • O utlwile medumo e mekae Mamela medumo e ka tlung le kantle. Di bale ka menwana menwana ya hao. (Kgefutsa ka metsotswana e 10)

SourceText: • How many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: • O phahamisitse menwana e mekae? O utlwa medumo efe?

SourceText: • Let’s try again. Can you hear any new sounds this time? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body? (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: • A re leke hape. Na ho na le medumo efe kapa efe e metjha eo o e utlwang hona jwale? Na o utlwa  medumo efe kapa efe kahara mmele wa hao? (Kgefutsa ka metsotswana e 10)

SourceText: • Open your eyes. What new sounds did you hear?
text: • Bula mahlo. O utlwa medumo efe e metjha?

SourceText: A Short Pause
text: Kgefu e Kgutshwane

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes.
text: Dula fatshe mme o kwale mahlo.

SourceText: Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: Mamela ha o phefumuloha ha moya o kena le ha o tswa.

SourceText: Notice how you feel.
text: Hlokomela tsela eo o ikutlwang ka yona.

SourceText: Take a few more deep breaths.
text: Phefumulohela hodimo ka makgetlo a mmalwa.

SourceText: When you are ready open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: Ha o se o lokile bula mahlo hape. Na ha o ikutlwe ka tsela e fapaneng?

SourceText: Remind yourself that “Everything is ok”.
text: Ikgopotse hore “Tsohle di tsamaya hantle”.

SourceText: Give Yourself A Hug
text: Iphe Hak e Mofuthu

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama hey.
text: Bella mama, bella mama hey.

SourceText: Hey there! How are you feeling today? Do you feel great?!
text: Dumelang bo! Le ikutlwa jwang kajeno? Na le ikutlwa le le shapo?

SourceText: Maybe not. Maybe you shouted again at your children today? Maybe you got angry and said something you don't feel proud of? It’s ok. It’s super stressful right now.
text: Mohlomong ha ho jwalo. Mohlomong le ile la omanya bana ba lona hape kajeno? Mohlomong le ile la halefa mme la bua ntho e itseng eo le seng motlotlo ka yona. Ho tla loka. Seterese se sengata haholo hona jwale.

SourceText: Take a deep breath and think of one thing you did today that you do feel proud of. It doesn't have to be big. And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug. And now think of one thing you did today that you don't feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow? And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Phefumulohela hodimo mme o nahane ka ntho e le nngwe eo o e entseng eo o leng motlotlo ka yona. Ha ho hlokahale hore ebe ntho e kgolo. Kopa mmele wa hao ka diphaka tsa hao mme o iphe hak e kgolo. Nahana ka ntho e le nngwe eo o e entseng eo o leng motlotlo ka yona. O ka etsa eng ka tsela e fapaneng hoseng? Kopa mmele wa hao ka diphaka tsa hao mme o iphe hak e kgolo.

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.
text: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Dumela @fields.user_name! Na o ne o tseba hore 3 ke palo ya mohlolo? Hema ho hula moya ka makgetlo a mararo mme o heme ho lokolla moya ka mekgetlo a mararo. Jwale o ikutlwa jwang? Na ha o ikutlwe ka tsela e fapaneng?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.count is a number (counter for list)

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Dumela! Na o ne o tseba hore 3 ke palo ya mohlolo? Hema ho hula moya ka makgetlo a mararo mme o heme ho lokolla moya ka mekgetlo a mararo. Jwale o ikutlwa jwang? Na ha o ikutlwe ka tsela e fapaneng?

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now? Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now? What are three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Mefuta e meraro ya dijo tseo o di ratang haholo ke efe? Na o ka bolela dintho tse tharo tseo o di bonang hona jwale? Na o ka bolela medumo e meraro eo o e utlwang hona jwale? Ke dintho dife tse tharo tseo o di lebohelang hong jwale?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three? How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Three is a magical number!
text: Hema ho hula moya ka makgetlo a mararo mme o heme ho lokolla moya ka mekgetlo a mararo. Jwale o ikutlwa jwang? Na ha o ikutlwe ka tsela e fapaneng? Tharo ke palo ya mohlolo!

SourceText: Release Some Energy
text: Fokotsa Matla a Mang

SourceText: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Pause Power!
text: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Matla a Kgefu!

SourceText: What’s Pause Power I hear you say? It’s the ability to transform from a grumpy, angry person into a calm, clear one.
text: Matla a Kgefu ao ke utlwang o bua ka wona ke eng? Ke bokgoni ba ho fetola motho ya tenehile, ya halefileng ho ba motho ya kgutsing le ya hlaphohetsweng.

SourceText: When I’m feeling frustrated I plant my feet firmly on the ground and I breathe in and out three times as slowly as I can. Sometimes I imagine I’m smelling a flower and blowing out a candle.
text: Ha ke ikutlwa ke tenehile ke hloma maoto a ka fatshe ka thata ebe ke hula le ho lokolla moya ka makgetlo a mararo butle kamoo nka kgonang. Ka dinako tse ding ke nahana hore ke fofonela dipalesa kapa ke butswela kerese.

SourceText: Da ta! Pause Power! My transformation from grumpy to calm is complete!
text: Da ta! Matla a Kgefu! Phetoho ya ka ya ho tloha ho motho ya tenehileng ho ya ho motho ya kgutsitseng e fedile!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Itlhokomele

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Hlokomela hore na ke eng e etsahalang ho wena hona jwale. O nahanang? Na o nahana dintho tse ntle kapa tse mpe? O ikutlwa jwang? Na o na le boikutlo bo botle kapa bo bobe? Mmele wa hao o ikutlwa jwang? Na o ikutlwa o tsisipane kapa o phutholohile?

SourceText: Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest.
text: Bua le pelo ya hao ka tsela e mosa le e bonolo. O ka nna wa batla ho beha letsoho le leng pelong kapa sefubeng sa hao.

SourceText: You can then say the following words silently to yourself:
text: MMe o ka ipolella mantswe a latelang ka lentswe le tlaase:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need extra support.
text: Nka motsotswana o nahana ka ntho e o hlahetseng. Hopola hore o ka etsa sena neng kapa neng ha o utlwa eka o hloka tshehetso e eketsehileng.

SourceText: Cooking together
text: Ho pheha mmoho

SourceText: Children love to do what you do!
text: Bana ba rata ho etsa seo o se etsang!

SourceText: Let your baby play with pots and spoons while you are making dinner.
text: Tlohela lesea la hao le bapale mmantswane wa dipitsa le dikgaba ha o ntse o hlophisa tinare.

SourceText: Dance Party
text: Phathi ya ho Tantsha

SourceText: Put on your favourite music or sing your favourite song and dance around the room with your toddler. If you have a baby hold them while you dance.
text: Letsa mmino mmino oo o o ratang haholo kapa o bine pina eo o e ratang mme o tantshe ka phapusing le ngwana wa hao. Haeba o na le lesea le tshware ha le tantsha.

SourceText: Dance in different ways or with different parts of your body.
text: Tantshang ka ditsela tse sa tshwaneng kapa ka dikarolo tse sa tshwaneng tsa mmele.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Let’s dance with our knees and hips.”
text: Ka mohlala, “Tantsha jwaloka tshwene”, “Tantsha jwaloka kgoho” kapa “A re tantshe ka mangole le matheka.”

SourceText: Think up different instructions. Be seriously playful!
text: Nahana ka ditaelo tse sa tshwaneng. Imemisetse ho bapala!

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Ha pina e fela, bohle ba eme tsi! ka tsela e qabolang.

SourceText: Notice what rhythms or movements they like!
text: Hlokomela merethetho le metjeko eo ba e ratang!

SourceText: Down in a ditch!
text: Theohela ka forong!

SourceText: Sit on a chair and put your toddler on your lap facing you. Hold them firmly under the arms.
text: Dula setulong mme o behe ngwana wa hao ya seng a tseba ho tsamaya seropeng sa hao a o shebile. Mo tshware ka tiyo tlasa diphaka tsa hao.

SourceText: Gently bounce your legs and say in a soft voice “Baby horse, baby horse, baby horse, baby horse”
text: Tila hanyane ka maoto fatshe ka lentswe le fatshe o re “Petsana, petsana, petsana, petsana”

SourceText: Bounce your legs a bit more and say a bit louder “Little horse, little horse, little horse, little horse”
text: Eketsa ho tila ka maoto fatshe ebe ka lentswe le hodimonyana o re “Petsana, pesana, petsana, petsana”

SourceText: Bounce your legs more and say louder “Big horse, big horse, big horse, big horse”
text: Tila ka maoto fatshe le ho feta ebe o phahaphahamisa lentswe o re “Petsana, pesana, petsana, petsana”

SourceText: When you call out “Down in a ditch!” open your knees and let your child drop down between them. Make sure you hold them so they don’t fall far!
text: Ha o hweletsa “Theohela ka forong!” bula mangole a hao mme o tlohele ngwana wa hao a theohele pakeng tsa wona. Tiisa hore o a mo tshwara hore a se ke a wela hole!

SourceText: Funny Faces
text: Difahleho tse Qabolang

SourceText: Look at your baby in the eyes and make different funny faces.
text: Sheba ngwana wa hao ka mahlong mme o etse difahleho tse sa tshwaneng tse qabolang.

SourceText: Make a big face. Make a small face. Make a happy face. Make a surprised face.
text: Etsa sefahleho se seholo. Etsa sefahleho se senyane. Etsa sefahleho se thabileng. Etsa sefahleho se maketseng.

SourceText: Which ones make your baby smile or laugh? Do them again, even bigger this time!
text: Ke sefe se etsang hore lesea la hao le bososele kapa le tshehe? Se etse hape, se le seholo le ho feta lekgetlong lena!

SourceText: Play with different feelings and add sounds.
text: Bapala ka maikutlo a sa tshwaneng mme o kenye medumo.

SourceText: Copy their facial expressions too. Exaggerate them to make them funny.
text: Le wena kopitsa seo sefahleho sa hae se o bolellang sona. Feteletsa seo sefahleho se o bolellang sona hore o bonahale o qabola.

SourceText: Always end on a positive expression!
text: Kamehla qetella ka sefahleho se setle se thabileng!

SourceText: Mirror Game
text: Papadi ya Seipone

SourceText: • Get to your baby's level so they can see you and hear you.
text: • Kotsama hore o fihle boemong ba lesea e le hore le ka o bona le ho o utlwa.

SourceText: • Copy their facial expressions and sounds.
text: • Kopitsa seo sefahleho sa  hae se o bolellang sona le medumo.

SourceText: • It is simple and helps create a strong bond between you and your baby!
text: • Ke ntho e bonolo mme e ka thusa ho theha maqhama a matlatla pakeng tsa hao le lesea la hao!

SourceText: Musical Toes
text: Mmino wa Menwana ya Maoto

SourceText: Put your baby on their back.
text: Beha lesea fatshe le kakalletse.

SourceText: Wiggle their toe and say, “This little toe goes [funny sound].”
text: Koba menwana ya lona hanyane mme o re, “Monwana ona o monyane o duma tjena [etsa modumo o tshehisang].”

SourceText: Make a funny sound for each toe.
text: Etsa modumo o tshehisang ka monwanang ka mong wa leoto.

SourceText: Play with different sounds. For example, animal sounds, popping sounds, squeaky sounds, fart sounds.
text: Bapala ka medumo e fapaneng. Ka mohlala, modumo wa diphoofolo, medumo ya dintho tse kokotelwang, medumo e reng tswi!, modumo wa motho ya ntsha moya.

SourceText: Repeat this for all ten toes.
text: E phete ka menwana yohle e leshome.

SourceText: Try to make the last toe the biggest and funniest sound!
text: Leka ho etsa hore monwana wa ho qetela e be o moholo le o tshehisang le ho feta!

SourceText: Peek-a-Boo!
text: Ha-o-Mpone!

SourceText: • Cover your face with your hands.
text: • Ikwahele sefahleho ka matsoho a hao.

SourceText: • Quickly show your face and say "Peek-a-Boo!" or "Hello!" Babies love it!
text: • Ebe o hlahisa sefahleho kapele mme o re "Ha-o-Mpone!" kapa "Dumelang!" Masea a rata papadi ena haholo!

SourceText: See It Be It
text: E Bone O Be Yona

SourceText: Look around you and name something that you can see. For example, a tree or a cup.
text: Qamaka pela hao mme bolela lebitso la ntho eo o e bonang. Ka mohlala, sefate kapa komiki.

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it”.
text: E re ho ngwana wa hao “Ke bona sefate, a re be sefate”.

SourceText: Countdown from 5 and make the shape of a tree with your bodies. Be as big and silly as possible.
text: Balang ho tloha ho 5 ho ya tlase ebe le etsa sebopeho sa sefate ka mmele ya lona. Eba moholo mme o etse dintho tse tshehisang kamoo o ka kgonang.

SourceText: Now let your child have a turn. What can they see?
text: Jwale lekgetlong lena e be ngwana wa hao. O bona eng?

SourceText: If you can, go outside and be in nature. If you can’t, play it inside.
text: Ha o ka kgona, tswela ka ntle mme o be dinthong tsa tlhaho. Haeba o sa kgone, bapallang ka tlung.

SourceText: When you’ve done it a few times, add moves and sounds!
text: Ha le e bapetse ka makgetlo a mmalwa, kenyang metsamao le medumo!

SourceText: Shakers
text: Batsukutli

SourceText: Find an empty, clean plastic bottle or pot with a lid that closes tight.
text: Fumana botlolo ya polasitiki e sa tshelang, e hlwekileng kapa pitsa e nang le sekwaelo se kwalang ka thata.

SourceText: Fill it with sand, stones, uncooked rice, beans or any small objects that make an interesting sound.
text: E tlatse lehlabathe, majwe, raese e sa phehwang, dinawa kapa dintho tse nyane tse etsang medumo e thahasellisang.

SourceText: Move your body as you shake it in front of your baby.
text: Tsamaisa mmele wa hao ha o ntse o e tsukutla kapela lesea la hao.

SourceText: If it is safe, give it to your baby to shake!
text: Haeba ho bolokehile, e fe ngwana wa hao hore le yena a e tsukutle!

SourceText: Get creative! Can you find something colourful or try it with water?
text: Qapa dintho tse sa tshwaneng! Na o ka fumana ntho e mebalabala kapa o leke ka metsi?

SourceText: What sounds does your baby like?
text: Lesea la hao le rata medumo efe?

SourceText: The Sun is Coming!
text: Letsatsi le a Tla!

SourceText: Lie your baby on their back after washing them or changing their diaper.
text: Beha lesea la hao le kakalletse kamora ho le hlaphisa kapa ho le tjhentjha leleiri.

SourceText: Tell them the sun is coming! Wiggle your fingers like sun rays above their head and make your face a big smiling sun.
text: Le bolelle hore letsatsi le a tla! Bapadisa menwana ya hao jwaloka mahlasedi a letsatsi hloohong ya lona mme o etse hore sefahleho se be jwaloka letsatsi le bososelang haholo.

SourceText: Tell them the wind is coming! Blow softly over their body.
text: Le bolelle hore moya o a tla! Le butswele mmele habonolo.

SourceText: Tell them the rain is coming! Use your fingers to gently pat over their whole body like light raindrops.
text: Le bolelle hore pula e a tla! Le toboketse ka menwana ya hao habonolo mmele kaofela jwaloka marothodi a bobebe a pula.

SourceText: Tell them the clouds are coming! Wrap the towel or cloth around them like a blanket and cuddle them.
text: Le bolelle hore maru aa tla! Le thatele ka thaole kapa le phuthele ka kobo ebe o a le kuka.

SourceText: Play with different weathers. Which one does your baby like best?
text: Bapala ka maemo a lehodimo a fapaneng. Ke bofe boo lesea la hao le bo ratang ka ho fetisisa?

SourceText: Add sound effects or make it into a little song. Use the tune of another song you know!
text: Kenya medumo kapa etsa hore ho utlwahale eka ke pina e nyane. Sebedisa morethetho wa pina e nngwe eo o e tsebang!

SourceText: At the End of the Day
text: Qetellong  ya Letsatsi

SourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Qetellong  ya letsatsi ka leng, qeta motsotso o nahana ka letsatsi leo.

SourceText: Talk to your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Buisana le ngwana wa hao ka ntho e le nngwe e ntle kapa e tshehisang eo a e entseng.

SourceText: Praise yourself for one thing you did well today.
text: Ipabatse ka ntho e le nngwe eo o e entseng kajeno.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Nahana ka ntho e le nngwe eo o e lebohelang.

SourceText: You are a star!
text: O kgalala!

SourceText: Lullaby
text: Pina e Koeetsang

SourceText: When your baby or toddler cries, sing a soft song to calm you both down.
text: Ha lesea kapa ngwana wa hao a lla, bina pina e morethetho o bonolo hore bobedi ba lona le theole moya.

SourceText: Sing a soothing song you know or make up your own with a simple melody and some soothing words.
text: Bina pina e thobang maikutlo eo o tsebang kapa e lokisang kelello ya hao ka mmino o bonolo le mantswe a mang a thobang maikutlo.

SourceText: Repeat it over and over in a rhythmical way. For example, “My little one, oh little one”.
text: E phete ka makgetlo o se o latela morethetho. Ka mohlala, “Oi oi oi, ngwana wa lla, wa lla wa thola, o tla pepuwa ke mang? Oi oi.”

SourceText: Sing the same song regularly so your child gets used to it!
text: Bina pina e tshwanang kgafetsa ho fihlela ngwana wa hao a e tlwaela!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Tsoka letsoho la hao le letshehadi moyeng ka makgetlo a 8 o ntse o bala ho fihlela ho 8

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with each foot.
text: Pheta sena ka letsoho le leng. Pheta sena ka leoto ka leng.

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
text: Etsa sena ka makgetlo a 7, ebe makgetlo a 6 mme o tswele pele ho fihlela o fihla ho le 1.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Bohle ba hweletse “Kgoho ya Mohlolo” mme ba etse tantshe e ntle ka ho fetisisa ya kgoho ya mohlolo!

SourceText: Dance choreography
text: Morethetheo wa tantshi

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs.
text: Etsa morethetho wa tantshi ka dipina tseo bana ba hao ba di ratang haholo.

SourceText: First person does a dance move and everyone else copies.
text: Motho wa pele o qala tantshi mme bohle baa mo etsisa.

SourceText: Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Bohle ba fumana monyetla wa ho etella tantshi pele.

SourceText: Perform it for the household!
text: Tantshetsang lelapa!

SourceText: Play or sing your favourite music and dance around the room.
text: Letsa kapa bina pina eo le e ratang mme le tantshe katlung.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Dance with just our knees and hips”.
text: Ka mohlala, “Tantsha jwaloka tshwene”, “Tantsha jwaloka kgoho” kapa “Tantsha ka mangole le matheka.”

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Ha pina e fela, bohle ba eme tsi! ka tsela e qabolang.

SourceText: Give your child a chance to be the one to stop the music!
text: Neha ngwana wa hao monyetla wa ho ba ho emisa mmino!

SourceText: Freeze dance
text: Dantshi e ema tsi

SourceText: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances.
text: Bapalang mmino kapa motho e mong a bine pina, ebe bohle baa tantsha.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone must freeze.
text: Ha pina e fela, bohle ba eme tsi.

SourceText: Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Motho wa ho qetela ya ntseng a dantsha, ke yena eo e bang moahlodi lekgetlong le latelang ha ho tantshwa.

SourceText: A variation to Freeze Dance is Animal Dance: It’s the same as Freeze Dance but when the music stops, one member of the family calls out the name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: Ha le tloha ho Tantshi ya ho Ema Tsi! le fetele ho Tantshi ya Diphoofolo: E tshwanang le Tantshi ya ho Ema Tsi! empa ha mmino o ema, setho se seng sa lelapa se bitsa lebitso la phoofolo, ebe bohle eba phoofolo eo.

SourceText: Mirror
text: Seipone

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or even as a group.
text: Papadi ena e ka bapalwa ke dipara kapa esita le ke sehlopha.

SourceText: Stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: Emang le shebane kapa le entse lesakana la nkope.

SourceText: One person leads first while everyone else must copy, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
text: Motho e mong o qala papadi mme bohle baa mo etsisa, ba leka ho hata hantle ka nako e tshwanang le ya moetapele wa bona.

SourceText: Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone to follow! Explore moving different body parts and in different levels.
text: Tiisa hore moetapele o hata butle ka ho lekaneng hore bohle ba kgone ho mo latela! Ithute ho tsamaisa ditho tsa mmele ka ditsela tse sa tshwaneng le maemong a sa tshwaneng.

SourceText: After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
text: Kamora nako, tjhentjhang ya etellang pele. O fe bohle monyetla wa ho etella pele.

SourceText: Try it with no leaders!
text: O se ke wa e leka seo ka baetapele bafe kapa bafe!

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support your child's learning.
text: Shebella video ena ho o thusa hore o tshehetse thuto ya ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support your child's learning.
text: Mamela molaetsa ona o mamelwang ho o thusa ho tshehetsa thuto ya ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: Here are 5 steps that you can do to help your children continue learning during this time:
text: Ena ke mehato e 5 eo o ka e nkang ho thusa bana ba hao ho tswela pele ba ithuta nakong ena:

SourceText: 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: 1. Qapa lenaneo le amanang le ho ithuta le mosebetsi wa sekolo

SourceText: 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: 2. Etsa hore ho ithuta ho be monate mme ho tsamaisane le papadi

SourceText: 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher
text: 3. Hopola hore o motswadi ESENG titjhere e kenelang e nngwe

SourceText: 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: 4. Dula o buisana le sekolo le matitjhere a ngwana wa hao

SourceText: 5. Support your child when they return to school
text: 5. Tshehetsa ngwana wa hao ha a tswa sekolong

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Thaepa “1” ho ya ho “5” hore o ithute haholwanyane ka keletso ka nngwe. Thaepa “N” ho emisa keletso ena.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support your child's learning:
text: Ka kopo kgetha palo e nngwe haeba o batla ho ithuta haholwanyane ka ho tshehetsa thuto ya ngwana wa hao:

SourceText: Step 5. Support your child when they go back to school
text: Mohato wa 5. Tshehetsa ngwana wa hao ha a kgutlela sekolong

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Bolella @fields.child_nickname hore ha ho phoso ho ikutlwa a tshohile kapa a kgathatsehile ka ho kgutlela sekolong. Tlohela ngwana wa hao a bolele kamoo a ikutlwang kateng. Hape ke ntho e tlwaelehileng hore ngwana wa hao a itshware ka tsela e fapaneng le tseo eo a tlwaetseng ho itshwara ka yona. Buisanang ka hore na ho kgutlela sekolong ho ka nna ha fapana jwang le kamoo a ka itshireletsang kateng ho COVID-19. Mo botse hore na letsatsi le tsamaile jwang mme o mo tshehetse haeba a kopane le mathata afe kapa afe.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Bolella ngwana wa hao hore ha ho phoso ho ikutlwa a tshohile kapa a kgathatsehile ka ho kgutlela sekolong. Tlohela ngwana wa hao a bolele kamoo a ikutlwang kateng. Hape ke ntho e tlwaelehileng hore ngwana wa hao a itshware ka tsela e fapaneng le tseo eo a tlwaetseng ho itshwara ka yona. Buisanang ka hore na ho kgutlela sekolong ho ka nna ha fapana jwang le kamoo a ka itshireletsang kateng ho COVID-19. Mo botse hore na letsatsi le tsamaile jwang mme o mo tshehetse haeba a kopane le mathata afe kapa afe.

SourceText: Step 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: Mohato wa 2. Etsa hore ho ithuta ho be monate mme ho tsamaisane le papadi

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep @fields.child_nickname interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Bana ba ithuta hantle haholo ha ho ithuta ho le monate! Leka ho fumana ditsela tsa ho etsa hore @fields.child_nickname a ithute a ntse a bapala hore a dule a na le thahasello ebile a le sehlahlo. Thaepa “thuso” haeba o hloka dikeletso dife kapa dife tsa ho natefisa thuto!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep your child interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Bana ba ithuta hantle haholo ha ho ithuta ho le monate! Leka ho fumana ditsela tsa ho etsa hore ngwana wa hao a ithute a ntse a bapala hore a dule a na le thahasello ebile a le sehlahlo. Thaepa “thuso” haeba o hloka dikeletso dife kapa dife tsa ho natefisa thuto!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a father NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Mohato wa 3. Hopola hore o ntate ESENG titjhere e kenelang e nngwe

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at @fields.child_nickname's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Mosebetsi wa hao ke ho tshehetsa ngwana wa hao ka ho qapa sebaka sa ho ithuta. Ha ho hlokahale hore o tsebe dikarabo tsohle. Mo thuse hore a batlisise dintho tseo a di thahasellang mme a botse dipotso. Tsamaya ka lebelo la @fields.child_nickname mme o imamelle.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a mother NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Mohato wa 3. Hopola hore o mme ESENG titjhere e kenelang e nngwe

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Mohato wa 3. Hopola hore o motswadi ESENG titjhere e kenelang e nngwe!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at your child's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Mosebetsi wa hao ke ho tshehetsa ngwana wa hao ka ho qapa sebaka sa ho ithuta. Ha ho hlokahale hore o tsebe dikarabo tsohle. Mo thuse hore a batlisise dintho tseo a di thahasellang mme a botse dipotso. Tsamaya ka lebelo la ngwana wa mme o imamelle.

SourceText: Step 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: Mohato wa 1. Qapa lenaneo le amanang le ho ithuta le mosebetsi wa sekolo

SourceText: Make a daily plan with @fields.child_nickname for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Etsa moralo wa letsatsi le letsatsi le @fields.child_nickname wa hore na ke neng a ka qetang nako a etsa mesebetsi e amanang le thuto. Sena se ka akarelletsa ho hlophisa mosebetsi wa sekolo le mesebetsi e meng ya inthaneteng, ya ho bala, ya ho ngola kapa bonono. Iphe monyetla wa ho kgema le maemo mme ho be le nako ya ho bapala le ya ho phomola.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Make a daily plan with your child for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Etsa moralo wa letsatsi le letsatsi le ngwana wa hao wa hore na ke neng a ka qetang nako a etsa mesebetsi e amanang le thuto. Sena se ka akarelletsa ho hlophisa mosebetsi wa sekolo le mesebetsi e meng ya inthaneteng, ya ho bala, ya ho ngola kapa bonono. Iphe monyetla wa ho kgema le maemo mme ho be le nako ya ho bapala le ya ho phomola.

SourceText: Step 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: Mohato wa 4. Dula o buisana le sekolo le matitjhere a ngwana wa hao

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with @fields.child_nickname’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Batla tsela ya ho dula o buisana le titjhere le sekolo sa @fields.child_nickname hore o dule o na le tsebo, botsa dipotso mme o fumane tataiso e eketsehileng. Haeba o sokola kapa o tseba motho ya sokolang ka mosebetsi wa sekolo kapa boemo ba lapeng, ka kopo buisana le titjhere eo o ikutlwang o atamellane le yona ka taba ena. Dihlopha tsa batswadi kapa dihlopha tsa motseng le tsona ekaba tsela e molemo ya ho tshehetsana ka mosebetsi wa hao wa ho ithutela lapeng.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with your children’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Batla tsela ya ho dula o buisana le titjhere le sekolo sa bana ba hao hore o dule o na le tsebo, botsa dipotso mme o fumane tataiso e eketsehileng. Haeba o sokola kapa o tseba motho ya sokolang ka mosebetsi wa sekolo kapa boemo ba lapeng, ka kopo buisana le titjhere eo o ikutlwang o atamellane le yona ka taba ena. Dihlopha tsa batswadi kapa dihlopha tsa motseng le tsona ekaba tsela e molemo ya ho tshehetsana ka mosebetsi wa hao wa ho ithutela lapeng.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: O sebeditse ka ho eketsa boiphihlelo bo bong Mokotleng wa hao wa Dithulusi tsa Botswadi! Matsatsing a seng makae a tlang, leka ho qala moralo wa ho ithuta le ngwana wa hao o akarelletsang dipapadi le e tsepamisitsweng thutong. Ho thusa ngwana wa hao ho tswela pele a ithuta nakong ena e thata ho bohlokwa haholo. Boikitlaetso ba hao bo etsa phapang e kgolo!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: O sebeditse ka ho eketsa mokato o mong Ntlong ya hao ya Tshehetso! Matsatsing a seng makae a tlang, leka ho qala moralo wa ho ithuta le ngwana wa hao o akarelletsang dipapadi le e tsepamisitsweng thutong. Ho thusa ngwana wa hao ho tswela pele a ithuta nakong ena e thata ho bohlokwa haholo. Boikitlaetso ba hao bo etsa phapang e kgolo!

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Rea utlwisisa hore kannete ho ka ba thata dinakong tsena. Ka kopo thaepa “Thuso” haeba o batla thuso kapa tataiso efe kapa efe e eketsehileng. Ke tla bua le wena hamorao @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Rea utlwisisa hore kannete ho ka ba thata dinakong tsena. Ka kopo thaepa “Thuso” haeba o batla thuso kapa tataiso efe kapa efe e eketsehileng. Ke tla bua le wena hamorao!

SourceText: Rain on the Mountain
text: Pula Thabeng

SourceText: Call out, “There’s rain on the mountain”.
text: Hweletsa, “Ho na le pula thabeng”.

SourceText: Everyone else replies “Run, run, run” while running around the space.
text: Bohle ba arabela ka hore “Mathang, mathang, mathang” ha ba ntse ba matha hona lapeng moo.

SourceText: Call out different instructions. For example, touch something red or hop like a frog.
text: Hweletsa ditaelo tse sa tshwaneng. Ka mohlala, tshwara ntho e kgubedu kapa qhomaqhoma jwalo ka senqanqana.

SourceText: Keep playing and change the instructions each time.
text: Tswela pele o bapala le ho fetola ditaelo nako le nako.

SourceText: You can use this as a fun way to learn colours or even tidy up!
text: O ka sebedisa sena e le papadi e monate ya ho ithuta ka mebala kapa le hona ho hlwekisa!

SourceText: Run Around and Do This
text: Matha mme le Etse Sena

SourceText: Everyone runs around the room or garden.  Make sure the space is large enough and safe.
text: Bohle ba matha ka kamoreng kapa jareteng.  Tiisa hore sebaka se seholo ka ho lekaneng ebile se bolokehile.

SourceText: At any time, someone can stop somewhere and say, “When you get over here, you do this!”
text: Neng kapa neng, motho a ka ema kaekae mme a re, “Ha le fihla mona, le etsa tjena!”

SourceText: What you do can be anything: push-ups, singing a song, crying, jumping…
text: Seo o se etsang ekaba eng kapa eng: diphushapo, ho bina pina, ho lla, ho tlola...

SourceText: The more you play, the more there are things to do in more and more places.
text: Ha le bapala haholo, ho tla ba le dintho tse ngata tseo le ka di etsang dibakeng tse ding tse ngata.

SourceText: Each person can decide where to go and when.
text: Motho ka mong a ka etsa qeto ya hore na a ka ya hokae hona neng.

SourceText: It’s fun to interact with other people who are doing the same thing as you!
text: Ho monate ho kopana le batho ba bang ba etsang dintho tse tshwanang le tseo o di etsang!

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it!”
text: E re ho ngwana wa hao “Ke bona sefate, a re be sefate!”

SourceText: Ship to Shore
text: Ho Tloha Sekepeng Ho ya Lebopong

SourceText: A fun active game where children learn different parts of a boat. Everyone must go to the place or activity that you call out.
text: Papadi e sehlahlo e monate moo bana ba ithutang dikarolo tsa sekepe. Bohle ba tlameha ho ya sebakeng se itseng kapa ba etsa papadi eo ba hweletsang.

SourceText: “Bow” means run to the front of the boat (room).
text: “Mokoro” o bolela ho mathela karolong e ka pele ya sekepe (kamore).

SourceText: “Stern” means run to the back of the boat.
text: “Mohata” o bolela ho mathela karolong e ka morao ya sekepe.

SourceText: “Starboard” means run to the right side and “Port” means run to the left side.
text: “Starboard” e bolela ho mathela karolong e ka ho le letona ya sekepe mme “Port” e bolela ho mathela ka letsohong le letshehadi.

SourceText: “Climb the rigging”: pretend to climb.
text: “Climb the rigging”: ho etsa eka o a hlwa.

SourceText: “Clean the deck”: pretend to clean the floor.
text: “Clean the deck”: ho etsa eka le hlwekisa fatshe.

SourceText: “Lifeboat, [number] people!”: hold hands in a circle with that many people and do knee bends.
text: “Sekepe sa pholoso, batho ba [palo]!”: tsharanang ka matsoho le entse sedikadikwe le batho ba bangata mme le kobe mangole.

SourceText: Everyone not in a lifeboat must swim!
text: Bohle ba seng ka sekepeng sa pholoso ba tlameha ho sesa!

SourceText: Stage Directions
text: Ditaelo tsa Sethaleng

SourceText: This is the same as Ship to Shore but with Stage Directions. This can be done in an elevated and safe area. The director gives the instructions.
text: Di tshwana hantle le tsa Ho Tloha Sekepeng ho ya Lebopong empa ke Ditaelo tsa Sethaleng. E ka bapallwa sebakeng se phahamisitsweng se bolokehileng. Motsamaisi o fana ka ditaelo.

SourceText: “Stage Right” means you go to the right.
text: “Lehlakore le Letona la Sethala” ho bolelwa hore o ya ka lehlakoreng le letona.

SourceText: “Stage Left” means you go to the left.
text: “Lehlakore le Letshehadi la Sethala” ho bolelwa hore o ya ka lehlakoreng le letshehadi.

SourceText: “Downstage” means you go down.
text: “Sethala se Tlaase” ho bolelwa hore o a theoha.

SourceText: “Upstage” means you go up.
text: “Sethala se Hodimo” ho bolelwa hore o a nyoloha.

SourceText: “Centre Stage” means you go to the centre of the stage.”
text: “Sethala se Bohareng” ho bolelwa hore o ya bohareng ba sethala.

SourceText: You can have fun actions like “Dramatic Death, Take a Bow, Open the Curtain, Clean the Floor,” etc.
text: Le ka bapala dipapadi tse monate jwaloka “Lefu le Bohloko, Nka Seqha, Bula Kgaretene, Hlwekisa Fatshe,” le tse ding.

SourceText: Instead of “Lifeboat” you make “Cast of Actors.” Those not in the cast become the director!
text: Ho fapana le “Sekepe sa Pholoso” le ka etsa “Dibapadi tse Kgethilweng.” Ya seng lenaneng la dibapadi eba motsamaisi!

SourceText: Superpowers
text: Matla a maholo

SourceText: Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds.
text: Nahana ka matla a maholo. Ka mohlala, ho ya kae kapa kae ka ho panya ha leihlo, ho tsamaya ka nako, ho bala dikelello.

SourceText: Ask your child “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?
text: Botsa ngwana wa hao “Haeba o ne o na le matla a maholo a ho […] o ne o tla a sebedisa jwang?

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act it out.
text: Mo kgothalletse ho itheha lebitso la lebitso la mohale e moholo mme a tshwantshise seo.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you!
text: Ebe o mo tlohella hore a o kgethele mohale e moholo!

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Tiisa hore o itshwara jwaloka yena le wena!

SourceText: Transform the object
text: Fetola ntho e itseng

SourceText: Everyday household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games
text: Dintho tsa lelapa tsa letsatsi le letsatsi tse kang mafielo, dimmpo, kapa dikhafo ekaba disebediswa tse tshehisang bakeng sa dipapadi

SourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be
text: Beha ntho bohareng ba kamore mme neng kapa neng ha motho a na le ntlha, o qhomela ka hare mme o bontsha bohle hore na ntho eo ekaba eng

SourceText: For example, a broom might be ridden as a horse or a microphone or a guitar!
text: Ka mohlala, lefielo le ka palangwa jwaloka pere kapa maekrofouno kapa katara!

SourceText: What Are You Doing?
text: O Etsang?

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play
text: Papadi ena e ntle ha e bapalwa ke batho ba fetang ba 2.

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner
text: Motho e mong o etsa eka o etsa ntho e itseng – mohlala, ho kama moriri kapa ho pheha dijo tsa tinare

SourceText: Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Ebe e mong o a mo botsa, “O etsang?”

SourceText: The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”
text: Motho wa pele o lokela ho bolela ntho e sa tsamaisaneng le ho kama moriri, ka mohlala, “Ke fasa dieta.”

SourceText: The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Motho wa bobedi ebe o qala ho etsa eka o fasa dieta ho fihlela motho wa boraro a botsa, “O etsang?”

SourceText: The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text: Ka dinako tsohle karabo e lokela ho ba ntho e fapaneng le seo o hlileng o se etsang!

SourceText: Worms Go Home
text: Diboko di Ya Hae

SourceText: Lie on your tummies and pretend your index fingers are a wiggly worm.
text: Paqamang ka dimpa mme le etse eka menwana ya lona ya bosupa ke diboko tse nyonyobang.

SourceText: With your other hand make a worm house by making a circle with your fingers and thumb and place it on the floor.
text: Ka letsoho le leng etsa ntlo ya seboko ka ho etsa sedikadikwe ka menwana ya hao ya letsoho hammoho le o motona ebe o le beha fatshe.

SourceText: Call out an instruction for your finger to touch, like “Worms on noses” or “Worms on ears”
text: Hweletsa ditaelo hore monwana wa hao o tshware, jwaloka “Diboko dinkong” kapa “Diboko ditsebeng”

SourceText: When you call out “Worms go home”, your wiggly worm has to find a worm house as quickly as possible.
text: Ha o hweletsa “Diboko di ya hae”, seboko se nyonyobang se lokela ho fumana ntlo ya seboko kapele kamoo ho ka kgonehang.

SourceText: The last worm to find a home calls out the instructions next.
text: Seboko sa ho qetela sa ho fihla lapeng se hweletsa ditaelo tse latelang.

SourceText: Keep playing until you feel rejuvenated from lying down.
text: Le nne le bapale ho fihlela le ikutlwa le le mahlahahlaha kamora ho paqama fatshe.

SourceText: Blind Dragon
text: Lakabane e Foufetseng

SourceText: This game is great if you have at least 4 people
text: Papadi ena e monate haeba bonyane le le batho ba 4

SourceText: Tell the story about a ferocious dragon who lived near a village. He would sneak into the village at night and steal people’s treasures – anything they loved.  Anybody who tried to take their treasure back would be eaten alive.  This continued for many years until the dragon became old, fat, and blind from sitting on his treasure and gazing at the glare of the gold coins. Then the townspeople could try and sneak into his lair and steal back their relatives’ treasure.
text: Pheta pale ya lakabane e foufetseng e dulang pela motse. E ne e kena motseng e nanara bosiu mme e utswa matlotlo a batho – eng kapa eng eo ba e ratang.  Mang kapa mang ya neng a leka ho kgutlisa letlotlo la hae e ne e mo harola a ntse a phela.  Sena se tswetse pele ka dilemo ho fihlela lakabane ena e tsofetse, e le tenya ebile e foufetse ka lebaka la ho dula letlotlong la yona le ho sheba ditjhelete tsa kgauta. Ebe batho ba toropo eo ba leka ho nanarela selaong sa yona ho ya utswa matlotlo a beng ka bong ka lenyele.

SourceText: One person plays the dragon. Dragon sits blindfolded or with eyes closed surrounded by a pile of treasure.
text: Motho e mong o bapala e le lakabane. Lakabane e foufetseng kapa e kwetseng mahlo e dutse e potapotilwe ke qubu ya matlotlo.

SourceText: Everyone has one piece of treasure that they must steal back.
text: E mong le e mong o nka sekotwana sa letlotlo leo a tlamehang ho le utswa hore le kgutle.

SourceText: If the dragon hears you and points at you, you must go back to the starting place.
text: Ha lakabane e o utlwa mme e o supa, o tlameha ho kgutlela sebakeng seo o qadileng ho sona.

SourceText: Only one person can try to get the treasure at a time.
text: Ke motho a le mong ya ka lekang ho fumana letlotlo ka nako.

SourceText: Dancing with Angels
text: Ho Tantsha le Mangeloi

SourceText: This activity helps children learn how to lead. It also builds trust between you and your child.
text: Tantshi ena e thusa bana ho ithuta ho etella pele. Hape e etsa hore wena le ngwana wa hao le tshepane.

SourceText: Play a piece of music that is gentle and relaxed to encourage smooth and calming movement.
text: Bapala mmino o thobang maikutlo le o phodileng ho kgothalletsa motsamao o bonolo le o thobang maikutlo.

SourceText: One person goes first and closes their eyes while the other person is the guardian angel or protector.
text: Motho e mong o ya pele mme o kwala mahlo a hae ha motho e mong e le lengeloi la motataisi kapa mosireletsi.

SourceText: The guardian angel must protect the person with their eyes closed from harm while gently dancing together.
text: Lengeloi la motataisi le tlameha ho sireletsa motho ka mahlo a lona a kwetsweng hore a se ke a lemala ha ba ntse ba tantsha mmoho.

SourceText: When the music ends, the dancer can open their eyes before switching roles.
text: Ha mmino o fela, motantshi a ka bula mahlo pele le tjhentjhana.

SourceText: Drawing
text: Ho Toroya

SourceText: Children love to draw! It helps build creativity.
text: Bana ba rata ho toroya! Ho thusa hore motho a be le boqapi.

SourceText: Get some pens or crayons and a piece of paper or cardboard.
text: Tshwara dipene kapa dikerayone le pampiri kapa khateboto.

SourceText: Let your children freely draw whatever they want.
text: Dumella bana ba hao hore ba ikutlwe ba lokolohile ho toroya eng kapa eng eo ba e batlang.

SourceText: While your child is drawing, use words to describe what they are doing: “I see you are drawing a person” or “I see you are making lines with the red crayon.”
text: Ha ngwana wa hao a ntse a toroya, sebedisa mantswe ho hlalosa seo ba se etsang: “Kea bona hore o torora  motho” kapa “Kea bona hore o etsa mela ka kerayone e kgubedu.”

SourceText: You can also have fun drawing next to them.
text: Le wena o ka thabela ho teroya o le haufi le bona.

SourceText: Put their drawings up on the wall, refrigerator, or outside to decorate the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Maneha ditshwantsho tseo ba di toroyileng leboteng, foritjheng, kapa kantle ho kgabisa ntlo – seo se tla etsa hore bana ba hao ba ikutlwe ba ratwa!

SourceText: Listening to Sounds
text: Mamela Medumo

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes
text: Dula fatshe mme o kwale mahlo

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers
text: O utlwa medumo e mekae? Mamela medumo e ka tlung le kantle ho kamore. Di bale ka menwana menwana ya hao

SourceText: After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: Kamora metsotswana e leshome, o phahamisitse menwana e mekae? O utlwa medumo efe?

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds.
text: Leka hape ka metsotswana e meng e leshome.

SourceText: Can you hear any new sounds? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body?
text: Na ho na le medumo efe kapa efe e metjha eo o e utlwang? Na o utlwa  medumo efe kapa efe kahara mmele wa hao?

SourceText: Notice how you feel and ask your child how they are feeling.
text: Lemoha kamoo o ikutlwang kateng mme o botse ngwana wa hao hore na o ikutlwa jwang.

SourceText: Memory game – “When COVID-19 ends…”
text: Papadi ya mohopolo – “Ha COVID-19 e fela…”

SourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”
text: Motho wa pele o re, “Ha COVID-19 e fela, Ke tlo… (ka mohlala., ya serapeng kapa phakeng)”

SourceText: Second person adds to the first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Motho wa bobedi o phaella morerong wa motho wa pele, “Ha COVID-19 e fela, ke tlo ya serapeng ebe … (ka mohlala, ke etela motswalle wa ka e moholo)”

SourceText: Each person adds to the previous list of plans, trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Motho ka mong o phaella letotong la pele la meralo, a leka ho nahana ka dintho tsohle tse monate tseo a tla di etsa ha COVID-19 e fela.

SourceText: Self-portrait
text: Ho itlhahisa

SourceText: Here’s how your children can draw a picture of themselves!
text: Setshwantsho sena ke kamoo bana ba ka itoroyang kateng!

SourceText: Find a big piece of paper or cardboard. It needs to be the same length or slightly longer than the height of your child
text: Fumana pampiri e kgolo kapa khateboto. E lokela ho lekana kapa e be telele hanyane ho feta bophahamo ba ngwana wa hao

SourceText: Ask your child to lie down on the paper. Carefully draw the outline of your child.
text: Kopa ngwana wa hao hore a paqame hodima pampiri. Toroya ka hloko sebopeho sa ngwana wa hao.

SourceText: Now let your child fill in the outline: face, hair, clothes, shoes, or anything they want!
text: Jwale e re ngwana wa hao a tlatse dikgeo sebopehong sa hae: sefahleho, moriri, diaparo, dieta, kapa eng kapa eng eo a e batlang!

SourceText: Ask your child to draw things that they like and do not like outside of the outline
text: Kopa ngwana wa hao ho toroya dintho tseo a di ratang le tseo a sa di rateng tse ka thoko ho sebopeho sena

SourceText: Have a conversation with your child about these things. You may learn something about your child!
text: Buisana le ngwana wa hao ka dintho tsena. O ka nna wa ithuta ntho e nngwe ka ngwana wa hao!

SourceText: You can put their outline up in their room or anywhere in the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: O ka maneha sebopeho sa hae ka kamoreng ya hae kapa kae kapa kae ka tlung – seo se tla etsa hore bana ba hao ba utlwe hore o a ba rata!

SourceText: Story time
text: Nako ya dipale

SourceText: Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
text: Qala pale ka mantswe a reng “Ba re enere...”

SourceText: Let your child make up the next sentence
text: Dumella ngwana wa hao ho etsa polelo e latelang

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence
text: Ebe wena o etsa polelo

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story
text: Tjhentjhanang ho fihlela le entse pale e ntjha e monate

SourceText: Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
text: Tiisa hore qetellong pale e felella hamonate.

SourceText: Ask your child what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Botsa ngwana wa hao hore na karolo eo a e ratang haholo ya pale ke efe!

SourceText: The Interrupter
text: Mositisi

SourceText: Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
text: Kgetha mopheti wa pale ya tla qala tshomo.

SourceText: Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
text: Bamamaedi ba tshomo ba ka sitisa ka lentswe neng kapa neng.

SourceText: The storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
text: Mopheti wa pale o tlameha ho kenyelletsa lentswe leo paleng ya hae.

SourceText: Try with a different storyteller!
text: Leka mopheti e mong wa pale!

SourceText: Three options
text: Dikgetho tse tharo

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane
text: Nahana ka maemo a mararo a sa tshwaneng. Ka mohlala, ho kganna koloi, ho tsamaisa sekepe kapa ho fofisa sefofane

SourceText: Say them to your child and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: A bolelle ngwana wa hao ebe o a mo botsa, “O ka rata boemo bofe?”

SourceText: Ask them why?
text: Mo botse hore na hobaneng?

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your child to do it for you
text: Jwale nahana ka maemo a mang a mararo ebe o kopa ngwana wa hao hore a o etsetse bona

SourceText: When I Was Younger
text: Ha Ke Ne Ke Le Monyane

SourceText: Children love to hear stories about your own life!
text: Bana ba rata ho utlwa dipale tsa bophelo ba hao!

SourceText: Think of a time when you were younger when something BIG happened to you
text: Nahana ka nako eo o neng o sa le monyane ha ntho e itseng e KGOLO e ile ya o hlahela

SourceText: It can be an adventure, happy memory, or challenge that you experienced
text: Ekaba ketsahalo e sa tlwaelehang, ho hopola ntho e monate, kapa phephetso eo o ileng wa kopana le yona

SourceText: Share it with your child and notice how they listen!
text: E phetele ngwana wa hao mme o bone kamoo a mamelang kateng!

SourceText: Co-chef
text: Seapehimmoho

SourceText: Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat.
text: Botsa ngwana wa hao hore na a ka rata ho ja dijo tsa mofuta ofe.

SourceText: Prepare it together! The first time, you may need to guide them.
text: Di pheheng mmoho! Ka lekgetlo la pele, o ka nna wa tlameha ho mo tataisa.

SourceText: Once your teen knows how to prepare the meal, let them take the lead and follow their instructions.
text: Hang ha motjha wa hao a tseba ho lokisa dijo, mo tlohelle a etelle pele le ho fana ka ditalo tsa hae.

SourceText: Let each child and teen in the house have a turn at being the head chef.
text: Tlohella ngwana le motjha ka mong katlung a thabele ho ba seapehi se seholo.

SourceText: You can even help them make a budget for ingredients!
text: Hape o ka mo thusa ho etsa bajete ya dijo tse phehwang!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
text: Tsoka letsoho la hao le letshehadi moyeng ka makgetlo a 8 o ntse o bala ho fihlela ho 8.

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can.
text: Etsa sena kapele kamoo o ka kgonang o phahamisitse lentswe kahohle kamoo o ka kgonang.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Then do it for each foot.
text: Pheta sena ka letsoho le leng. Ebe o etsa sena ka leoto ka leng.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” when you’re finished and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Bohle ba hweletse “Kgoho ya Mohlolo” ha le qetile mme ba etsa tantshi e ntle ka ho fetisisa ya kgoho ya mohlolo!

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your teen's favorite songs.
text: Etsa morethetho wa tantshi ka dipina tseo motjha wa hao a di ratang haholo.

SourceText: Get active!
text: Fumana keletso!

SourceText: Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing
text: Nahanang ka mefuta e meraro ya boikwetliso boo le ka bo etsang mmoho. Ka mohlala, ho tsamaya, ho torota, ho bapala bolo kapa ho tantsha.

SourceText: Pick one together and try it out.
text: Kgethang bo le bong mmoho mme le bo leke.

SourceText: If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
text: Haeba bobedi ba ona le bo rata, etsang qeto ya hore na le tla ikwetlisa jwalo ka makgetlo a makae. Na e tla ba hang kapa habedi ka beke? Hoseng ho hong le ho hong?

SourceText: Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text: Mmoho nahanang ka ditsela tsa ho etsa hore ebo ebe nako e monate haholo. Na le ka torota ka nako e itseng? Na le ka tjhentjhana ka ho ba mokwetlisi? Na le ka kgothatsana ka meputso e menyane ya mahala?

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Today's tip is about how we can support positive family relationships at home.
text: Ha re kgona ho ba le dikamano tse nang le kgotso le tse lerato, bana ba rona ba tla ikutlwa ba sireletsehile ebile ba ratwa haholo. Keletso ya kajeno e amana le kamoo re ka tshehetsang dikamano tse mofuthu tsa lelapa ka lapeng.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder, they can guess the singer).
text: Bohle ba tlameha ho bolela lebitso la pina eo (ho ba thatafalletsa le ho feta, ba ka bolela sebini)

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Wa pele wa ho le bolela eba moetapele ya latelang ya tla kgetha kapa a bine pina e latelang.

SourceText: Pass the Snap
text: Fetisa Senepe

SourceText: This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: Papadi ena e bapalwa hantle ke batho ba 3.

SourceText: Start in a circle and pass one snap around the circle (or clap if you cannot snap).
text: Qalang sedikadikwe mme le fetise senepe se le seng sedikadikweng (kapa opa diatla haeba o sa kgone ho nka senepe).

SourceText: You snap once to throw the snap.
text: O nka senepe hang ebe o lahla senepe.

SourceText: You can bounce the snap, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: O ka lahlela senepe fatshe, wa se akgela moyeng mme wa se kapa ka makgetlo a mmalwa pele o se fetisa.

SourceText: The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.
text: Motswamao (o yang hodimo, tlaase, o otlolohileng, o kobehileng, o bidikang ho ya fatshe) le matla (a maholo, a manyane, a itekanetseng) tseo o akgelang senepe ka tsona di ama tsela eo motho e mong a tla se kapa ka yona.

SourceText: Look at the person you are throwing the snap to.
text: Sheba motho eo o mo akgelang senepe.

SourceText: The person who will catch it has to snap once to catch it.
text: Motho ya se kapang o tla lokela ho sheba senepe hang hore a se kape.

SourceText: When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing around the snap.
text: Ha bohle ba tlwaela sena, le ka qala ho tsamaya ka kamoreng, le ntse le fetisa senepe.

SourceText: Can you throw under the leg?  Behind the back?  Through your head?  Intercept a pass? Have fun with the snap!
text: Na o ka se akgela tlasa leoto?  Ka mokokotlong?  Hodima hlooho?  Wa se kapa ha se fetiswa? Thabelang papadi ya senepe!

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play.
text: Papadi ena e ntle ha e bapalwa ke batho ba fetang ba 2.

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair.
text: Motho e mong o etsa eka o etsa ntho e itseng – mohlala, ho kama moriri.

SourceText: A second person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Motho wa bobedi o a botsa, “O etsang?”

SourceText: The second person’s answer must always be something different from what they are actually doing!
text: Karabo ya motho wa bobedi e lokela ho ba ntho e fapaneng le seo a hlileng a se etsang!

SourceText: The next person should act out the second person’s answer and when someone asks what they are doing, their answer must be different from what they are actually doing!
text: Motho ya latelang o phethisa karabo ya motho wa bobedi mme motho e mong o botsa hore na o etsang, karabo ya hae e tlameha ho fapana le se hlileng se etsahalang!

SourceText: What’s new?
text: Tsa moraorao ke dife?

SourceText: Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or your foot, juggling, learning a new language, or playing an instrument?
text: Nahana ka tsebo e ntjha eo o ka ithutang yona hammoho le motjha wa hao. Ka mohlala, ho boloka bolo moyeng kapa leoto la hao, ho sokola, ho ithuta puo e ntjha, kapa ho letsa seletsa?

SourceText: Take turns in trying the new skill out.
text: Tjhentjhanang ka ho leka ho ithuta ntho e ntjha.

SourceText: Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text: Tiisang hore le a rorisana kapa ho babatsana, mme le leke ho ithuta le ho bapala mmoho!

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing.
text: Ho ka thusa ho nahana ka ditakatso, ditoro, boiphihlelo ba sekolong, dintho tseo a di ratang kapa tseo a sa di rateng. Ka mohlala, ha ke rate dibanana, thuto eo ke e ratang haholo ke saense, le kanneteng ke lakatsa eka nka bina.

SourceText: Say them to your teenager. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Di bolelle motjha wa hao. Ba kope hore ba bolele hore na ke efe eo e leng mafosisa.

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Ba kope o etse se tshwanang ho bona. Na wena le bona le ithutile ntho e ntjha e mong ka e mong?

SourceText: Talk to your teen about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Buisana le motjha wa hao ka ntho e le nngwe e ntle kapa e tshehisang eo a e entseng.

SourceText: Dream Travel
text: Toro ya ho Eta

SourceText: You can’t travel but you can dream! Ask your teen these questions.
text: O ke ke wa eta empa o ka lora! Botsa motjha wa hao dipotso tsena

SourceText: Where do you want to travel? How long will you be away? What will you pack? What will you do? What will you see?
text: O batla ho etela hokae? O tla nka nako e kae o le siyo? O tla paka eng? O tla etsang? O tla bona eng?

SourceText: Look at a map together if you have one.
text: Shebang mmapa mmoho haeba o le teng.

SourceText: Choose a country that they’ve never heard of and look it up together online.
text: Kgethang naha eo le eso kang le utlwela ka yona mme le e shebe inthaneteng.

SourceText: How was your day?
text: Letsatsi le tsamaile jwang?

SourceText: Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
text: Botsanang, “Ke eng e o thabisitseng kajeno?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “What was difficult today?”
text: Botsanang, “Ke eng e bileng thata kajeno?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “How can we help you?”
text: Botsanang, “Re ka o thusa jwang?”

SourceText: Try to do this together every day, when you are eating together or before bed
text: Lekang ho etsa sena letsatsi le letsatsi, ha le ja kapa pele le ilo robala

SourceText: Just a friendly chat
text: Buisanang ka tsela e nang le botswalle feela

SourceText: Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.
text: Buisanang le motjha wa lona ka ntho eo a e ratang.

SourceText: It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…
text: Ekaba ka eng kapa eng eo a kgethang ho bua ka yona: ebang ke dipapadi, metswalle, mmino, dikgalala...

SourceText: Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text: Leka ho mamela motjha wa hao mme o mo fe monyetla wa ho bua.

SourceText: What new thing did you learn about your teen from your chat?
text: Ke ntho efe e ntjha eo o ithutileng yona ka motjha wa hao ha le ntse le qoqa?

SourceText: Make up a story!
text: Qapa pale!

SourceText: Let your teen make up the next sentence.
text: Dumella motjha wa hao ho etsa polelo e latelang

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence.
text: Ebe wena o etsa polelo.

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
text: Tjhentjhanang ho fihlela le entse pale e ntjha e monate.

SourceText: Ask your teen what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Botsa motjha wa hao hore na karolo eo a e ratang haholo ya pale ke efe!

SourceText: Ask your teen “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?”
text: Botsa motjha wa hao “Haeba o ne o na le matla a maholo a ho […] o ne o tla a sebedisa jwang?

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act like a superhero.
text: Mo kgothalletse ho itheha lebitso la lebitso la mohale e moholo mme a itshware jwaloka mohale e moholo.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you.
text: Ebe o mo tlohella hore a o kgethele mohale e moholo.

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Tiisa hore o itshwara jwaloka yena le wena!

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat, or flying a plane.
text: Nahana ka maemo a mararo a sa tshwaneng. Ka mohlala, ho kganna koloi, ho tsamaisa sekepe kapa ho fofisa sefofane.

SourceText: Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: A bolelle motjha wa hao ebe o a mo botsa, “O ka rata boemo bofe?”

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text: Jwale nahana ka maemo a mang a mararo ebe o kopa motjha wa hao hore a o etsetse bona

SourceText: Second person adds to first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Motho wa bobedi o phaella morerong wa motho wa pele, “Ha COVID-19 e fela, ke tlo ya serapeng ebe… (ka mohlala, ke etela motswalle wa ka e moholo)”

SourceText: Yes, No or Maybe
text: Ee, Tjhe kapa Mohlomong

SourceText: Ask each other questions. They can be any questions about things you like or what you did today.
text: Botsanang dipotso tse ding. Ekaba dipotso dife kapa dife tse amanang le dintho tseo o di ratang kapa tseo o di entseng kajeno.

SourceText: The only rule is that you can’t answer Yes, No or Maybe
text: Molao feela ke hore o ke ke wa arabela ka Ee, Tjhe kapa Mohlomong

SourceText: How long can you last? How creative can you get with your answers?
text: Le ka qeta nako e kae? O ka bontsha bokgoni ba ho nahana jwang ka dikarabo tsa hao?

SourceText: Swap over and play again!
text: Tjhentjhanang ebe le bapala hape!

SourceText: There are no bad children...only difficult behaviours! All children misbehave but these tips can help.
text: Ha ho na bana ba babe...ke feela boitshwaro bo thatafatsang dintho! Bana bohle ba ka itshwara ka tsela e sa nepahalang empa dikeletso tsena di ka thusa.

SourceText: Which child do you want tips for?
text: O batla dikeletso molemong wa ngwana ofe?

SourceText: Please select the age of your child:
text: Ka kopo kgetha dilemo tsa ngwana wa hao:

SourceText: A. Under 1 month
text: A. Ya ka tlase ho kgwedi e 1

SourceText: B. 1-2 months
text: B. Ya dikgwedi di 1-2

text: C. Ya dikgwedi di 3-5

text: F. Ya dikgwedi di 15-18

text: G. Ya dikgwedi di 19-23

SourceText: Which behaviour is most like the one you want support for?
text: Ke boitshwaro bofe bo tshwanang le boo o batlang tshehetso ya bona?

SourceText: Here are 8 simple tips to help you with your teen:
text: Bona dikeletso tsena tse 8 tse bonolo tse ka o thusang ka motjha wa hao:

SourceText: 1. Keep it positive
text: 1. Bua ka ntho e lokelang ho etswa

SourceText: 2. Invest in time
text: 2. Qeta nako e ngata le yena

SourceText: 3. Create routines
text: 3. Eba le mananeo a ho etsa dintho

SourceText: 4. Be open to your children
text: 4. Phetlela bana ba hao sefuba

SourceText: 5. Use reasonable consequences
text: 5. Sebedisa ditlamorao tse utlwahalang

SourceText: 6. Solve problems with your teen
text: 6. Rarolla mathata le motjha wa hao

SourceText: 7. Keeping your teen safe online
text: 7. Tiisa hore motjha wa hao o bolokehile inthaneteng

SourceText: 8. Resolving crises when they happen
text: 8. Ho rarolla mathata ha a hlaha

SourceText: Type "1" to "8" if you want to learn more about a specific strategy.
text: Thaepa "1" ho ya ho "8" haeba o batla ho ithuta haholwanyane ka leqheka le itseng.

SourceText: Here are 5 simple tips to help you with your babies:
text: Bona dikeletso tsena tse 5 tse bonolo tse ka o thusang ka masea a hao:

SourceText: 1. Play with your baby
text: 1. Bapala le lesea la hao

SourceText: 2. Create routines
text: 2. Eba le mananeo a ho etsa dintho

SourceText: 3. Share books with your baby
text: 3. Bontsha lesea la hao dibuka

SourceText: 4. Cope with crying
text: 4. Sebetsana le ho lla

SourceText: 5. Redirect them to positive behaviours
text: 5. Le bontshe boitshwaro bo molemo

text: Thaepa "1" ho ya ho "5" haeba o batla ho ithuta haholwanyane ka leqheka le itseng.

SourceText: Here are 9 simple tips to help you with your children:
text: Bona dikeletso tsena tse 9 tse bonolo tse ka o thusang ka bana ba hao:

SourceText: 6. Ignore attention seeking and demanding behaviours
text: 6. Iphapanyetse boitshwaro ba ho batla hore ho shejwe yena feela le ba batla dintho ka nkane

SourceText: 7. Use reasonable consequences
text: 7. Sebedisa ditlamorao tse utlwahalang

SourceText: 8. Solving problems with your child
text: 8. Rarolla mathata le ngwana wa hao
